Cloud Architect  Your tasks  You are part of the internal IT, specifically the architecture team for PwC Switzerland. Within our cloud transformation program, you are responsible for the definition of standards, patterns and governance structures for the cloud platform. With your experience as a cloud architect, you enable the use of public cloud platforms for the Swiss firm. Together with the IT architecture team, the local solution engineering team and global cloud experts you are developing a Cloud Target Architecture that includes SaaS, PaaS and IaaS and enables PwC Switzerland to use different cloud services (MS Azure, AWS, GCP) while staying compliant with local and global security standards and policies. You bring your expertise to the Swiss IT architecture board. You are part of global and local projects and initiatives and are a key player in the firm's cloud transformation program. Furthermore, you support our internal customers and colleagues within IT (demand managers, requirements engineers, solution engineers). You provide input for the conception of new solutions and the migration of existing applications in the cloud. In that context, you act as a trusted advisor and cloud expert. Beyond concept and implementation of individual applications, you help the cloud platform team to establish an architecture and operational model for cloud-based applications. This includes the definition of a governance model, application blueprints, guidelines and best practice documentation. You are responsible to find solutions that fulfil the territory-specific requirements while staying aligned with global standards and solutions.    Your profile  You have a (technical) university degree Minimum of five years of experience in at least two IT solution development disciplines, including cloud architecture, network management, application development, middleware, database management or operations You have in-depth knowledge of modern software development, cloud architect, architecture methods, architecture frameworks (e.g. TOGAF), IT security issues and modern architecture approaches (microservices, data streaming etc.). Good understanding of strategic and new and emerging technology trends, and the practical application of existing, new and emerging technologies to new and evolving business and operating models You are an independent, outgoing and service-oriented personality with strong entrepreneurial thinking and analytical and conceptual skills. A confident appearance, a high quality awareness as well as pronounced communication and assertiveness distinguish you You like to work on different tasks at the same time and are willing to take on responsibility from the very beginning. You have very good knowledge of German and English (written and spoken)    Who we are – PwC as an employer  At PwC, we create value for both our people and clients in Assurance, Tax & Legal, Consulting, Deals and Digital Services. And you can do the same. Want to make an impact and shape the future of a leading professional services firm? Are you passionate and ready to embrace change? Then you've got what it takes to reimagine the possible. Everyone's career path is unique. That's why PwC offers countless personal and professional development opportunities that fit with your aspirations, supporting you to grow your own way – so you can become everything you want to be and more. More about Internal Services Display original ad

Job title: Cloud Architect / Senior Solution Engineer Salesforce Platform
Content:
Cloud Architect / Senior Solution Engineer Salesforce Platform 
        Job CategorySales    Job Details Salesforce Cloud Architect   What if you were empowered to solve the most complex business problems that Fortune 500 companies face today? What if you had the best social and mobile cloud technology stack to achieve that goal? What if you could work for a company that believes that top line growth is as important as giving back to the community? What if you could work alongside the best and brightest in the industry to craft innovative solutions and transformational strategies? All this in a driven, collaborative and rewarding environment… Sounds like fiction, you say?     Job Description:     The Salesforce Cloud Architect is apre-salescustomer-facing enterprise domain expert applying broad technical skills, with deep industry knowledge and business acumen, supporting sales teams in developing Salesforce value propositions that align to our customers’ business strategies on digital transformation and cloud adoption. The Salesforce Cloud Architect is a subject matter expert in one or more categories that may include: business strategy, application architecture, data & information, integration, security, cloud computing, technology, distributed platforms, mobile, and analytics. With a strong blend of technical and sales skills, the Salesforce Cloud Architect uses a consultative approach to understand business and technical requirements.   The Salesforce Cloud Architect determines which Salesforce and third party technologies to leverage in customer driven architectures, based upon product knowledge, industry experience, industry standard EA frameworks and Salesforce EA methodologies.   With a broad IT background including solution architecture, technical architecture, software/systems engineering, cloud computing, governance and SDLC, the Salesforce Cloud Architect leads key discussions and considerations around change programs from both a business and technical perspective.   The Salesforce Cloud Architect helps the sales teams develop industry specific, repeatable propositions and go to market strategies.   The Salesforce Cloud Architect also participates in the delivery of solution best practices, reference architectures, educational sessions and industry summits to existing customers, partners and to internal audiences.       Your Impact - Responsibilities:     • Business planning and strategy • Become a trusted advisor to CIO/CTO/EA level contacts and their teams as they look to move their business to a cloud architecture • Earn the trust of prospects' and customers’ CISO/CSO/Chief Risk Officer and similar. • Present Salesforce technology infrastructure, including demonstrating deep familiarity with company's platform capabilities, hosting infrastructure, security and integration capabilities • Understand the customer need and establish company's product as the best solution that addresses the technical and business requirements • Conduct architecture and technical workshops that may include enablement sessions • Manage customer technical due diligence and risk management processes • Work closely with other elements of the Salesforce organization, e.g. alliances, sales effectiveness, industry business unit, product marketing, etc. to develop and execute internal and external programs and initiatives • Assist sales teams in responses to RFPs and technical requirements documents • Participate in all appropriate product, sales, and procedural training and certification to acquire and maintain the knowledge necessary to be effective in the position • Attain quarterly and annual objectives assigned by management • Mentor and guide more junior technical resources    Minimum Qualifications:    • B.S. Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent work experience • Multi-year experience in either software, system or enterprise architecture disciplines • Good understanding of the architectural principles of cloud based platforms including SaaS, PaaS, multitenancy, multi-tiered infrastructure, etc. • Good understanding of all cloud offerings in the market and ability to discuss cloud architectures • Good understanding of enterprise application integration, including SOA, ESB, EAI, ETL environments as well as common EA topics such as process orchestration, BPM, CEP, MDM, BI/BA, etc. • A good understanding of the security processes, standards & issues involved in multi-tier cloud or hybrid applications • Familiar with principles of network, application and information security • Fluent German and English    Preferred Qualifications:    • Previous practitioner and/or implementation experience of Salesforce solutions or relevant solutions • Familiar with relevant (regional, vertical, etc.) data privacy and compliance requirements • Familiar with solution selling • Salesforce related development experience (Force.com, Java or C#, JavaScript), mobile development, modern frameworks, etc. • Experience of architectural frameworks such as TOGAF, Zachman, etc. • Familiar with design thinking and similar principle   *LI-Y         Posting Statement   Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.      Display original ad

Solutions Architect - Global Financial Services  DESCRIPTION AWS is looking for an experienced Solutions Architect to help advise our Financial Services customers on how to best adopt and leverage the value of AWS technology. This is an ideal role for someone with deep experience in the FSI industry, expert knowledge of financial services applications and infrastructure and a solid understanding of the transformational value cloud technologies can bring. In this role, you will serve as a core member of the Worldwide Financial Services Technology team, and play a key role in executing our go-to-market strategy. You will engage with customers to determine business needs, identify opportunities and issues, and develop related technical solutions and value propositions leveraging the power of AWS cloud technology.    BASIC QUALIFICATIONS • 10+ years of experience working in Financial Services organizations and implementing solutions in a regulated environment.• Very strong experience in the FSI industry and associated regulatory environment, expert knowledge of the supporting applications and infrastructure• 7 or more years of experience as an architect, designing and implementing large-scale solutions in the Financial Services industry. Deep experience with FSI-related applications such as core Insurance and Insurance systems, trading platforms, financial information systems, big data analytics, etc.• Solid understanding of virtualization and/or cloud computing technologies.     PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS • A strong understanding of AWS and/or technology as a service (Iaas,SaaS,PaaS) would be preferred but not required.• Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations and virtual teams.• A talent for being able to influence and build mindshare convincingly with any audience. Confident and experienced in public speaking to large audiences.• The ability to handle complex relationships and work in a team environment is a key requirement    Display original ad

Job title: Lead Solution & Application Architect iptiQ EMEA L&H
Content: Lead Solution & Application Architect iptiQ EMEA L&H            Location: Zurich, ZH, CH             Lead Solution & Application Architect iptiQ EMEA L&H    About iptiQ  Become a part of a growing and dynamic entrepreneurial team within the established Swiss Re Group. iptiQ is a start-up unit, established to provide innovative protection solutions directly to consumers. Our team delivers the coordination, infrastructure and competences that are key to driving forward this new business; working closely with our partners and clients. Our mission is to reduce the protection gap by simplifying life insurance and making it more accessible to people. Our motto is "now life is easier for everyone". For us this means making life insurance easier to sell, to buy and to trust.     About the Role  You will be the Lead Solution & Application Architect for the technology platform within the iptiQ EMEA Technology & Operations department. This is a rare opportunity to join a new business unit within an established company; combining the dynamic spirit of a start-up with the backing of Swiss Re's strong organisation.    As the Solution & Application Architect, you will work closely in multi-functional teams to shape the technology platform that fulfil our business and product vision and ultimately bring value to our customers and partners by disrupting the traditional insurance proposition. This will require solving complex problems within a distributed infrastructure by designing simple, scalable, reliable and configurable solutions. It also requires liaising with various stakeholders within and beyond iptiQ EMEA L&H to align the architecture and to ensure that it is fit for purpose.   Your responsibilities include:  Design new capabilities and/or components within our platform to maximize configurability, speed and efficiency and to scale business processes Create artefacts including solution designs, logical designs, sequence diagrams, API interface definitions, data schemas, etc. in close collaboration with software engineers Analyse and extend source code, focusing on simplicity, performance, maintainability and scalability Align architecture within and beyond iptiQ EMEA L&H to take advantage of synergies and to minimize total cost of ownership Shape a lean governance to align architecture and facilitate related meetings Develop vision for iptiQ's architecture and give guidance to software engineers and other stakeholders We are looking forward to working with you as the Lead Solution & Application Architect. You will report directly to the Head of Digital Innovation of iptiQ EMEA.     About the Team  iptiQ is a unit within the newly built Swiss Re Life Capital; established to deliver white-label life insurance solutions to be sold through partners, directly to consumers. iptiQ is young, motivated and technology driven team, organised to provide creative solutions for life insurance distributors across Europe that engage with consumers in non-traditional ways. Through our strong operational infrastructure, creative thinking, insurance know-how and ecommerce competences we want to drive the digitalization of the life insurance business in Europe.    About you  Qualifications:  Proven experience as a solution and application architect, i.e. 3+ years hands-on experience in solution and application architecture Proven software development capabilities, i.e. 5+ years hands-on experience as a developer Experienced in writing architecture-related artefacts like solution designs, sequence diagrams, API interface definitions, data schemas, etc. Experience in best practices around IT security and in treatment sensitive customer data according to GDPR (EU General Data Protection Regulation) Experience in workflow management, identity management, document management, etc. Experience with high-traffic micro services architectures and best practices around designing, scaling and monitoring concurrent systems You carefully evaluate design trade-offs and strive for simple, elegant, algorithmically efficient solutions You understand performance metrics, how to collect and use them to continuously improve performance, scalability and efficiency Experience in the design of API interfaces and of data-models Experience in CI/CD, test-driven-development (TDD) and automated testing    About you:  Great team player: you collaborate effectively with team members, express technical leadership supporting your views and ideas while keeping open to different opinions, being fearless and always supplying to the overall growth of the team Continuous learner who stays up-to-date with the latest trends and carefully vet with proper pragmatism and long-term vision the adoption of new technologies Master’s degree in computer science, engineering or equivalent working experience Ability to speak and write English fluently     We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.               Display original ad

IT Solution Architect Client & Partner 
    Julius Bär ist die führende Private-Banking-Gruppe der Schweiz, ausgerichtet auf die Betreuung und Beratung anspruchsvoller Privatkunden, sowie eine erstklassige Marke im globalen Wealth Management. Deshalb sind ein umfassendes Leistungsspektrum und eine erstklassige Dienstleistungsqualität unerlässlich – und engagierte Teams, die dahinter stehen.      Innovation, operative excellence and appreciation to our employees influence the IT of Bank Julius Baer. We invest continuously in the development of our existing IT landscape and offer through progressive thinking and efficiency the best possible service to our business units. As part of our global and strategic initiatives back office, channel, partner and wealth management systems will be replaced by future-oriented new solutions. To support our strategy, we are looking for the best talents who are willing to shape this challenging journey with us. If this appeals to you, then you should contact us.     IHRE AUFGABEN  As a Solution Architect for the Domain Client & Partner, you support us in the consolidation, harmonization, and renewal of our global Client Lifecycle applications.  Ensure delivery of artefacts defined along Bank Julius Baer project methodology (solution blueprint, solution designs, and security concepts) Stakeholder Management (incl. strong interaction with our partners from central architecture, security et al.) Prepare and present architectural options at decision boards (e.g. architecture boad) Specification of conceptual and logical architectures to meet strategic business, financial, and technology objectives Provide comprehensive architectural support for all aspects to ensure proposed solutions are technically viable and also consider harmonization in landscape wherever applicable Work closely with business and technical teams to ensure successful rollout of the solution Validate functional and non-functional requirements and make appropriate design adjustments, as well as provide effort estimates to support project management Conduct evaluation of new technology platforms and components and be the primary interface to product /technology vendors         IHRE FÄHIGKEITEN   Higher education in computer science / business informatics Strong communication skills (fluency in German and English is a key requirement) Multi-year experience as a solution architect or equivalent role Strong working experience in projects that had an emphasis in application integration, data architecture, or workflow management Strong expertise in JEE, SOA, REST, SSO, and containers TOGAF or similar certification Motivated personality, strong interest in digitisation aspects and ability to work under pressure      Wir freuen uns auf die Zusendung Ihrer vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen. Job title: IT Senior Manager BI Analytics and Master Data
Content: IT Senior Manager BI Analytics and Master Data      IT Senior Manager BI Analytics and Master Data     Posted Date2 months ago(9/17/2019 8:00 AM)  Job CodeDJOBCountrySwitzerlandFunctionInformation TechnologyCityHolderbank# of Openings1     Overview     No agencies will be considered for this job posting.     The IT Senior Manager BI Analytics and Master Data is in charge of defining the technical roadmap/strategy, ensuring implementation and the run of the IT BI and Analytics products and services as well as the Master data management solutions and processes.   The job incumbent is responsible for the IT data interfaces and the integration for the Group BI and Analytics solution.This includes the planning with the country or region (IT and Digital team) of Group solutions roll out or related maintenance activities managed locally as well as the coordination of the Business Intelligence Community of Practice at group level.This also implies driving and governing the Group and Corporate solutions and product roadmap, design, delivery and maintenance for BI/Analytics systems as well as digital products for data analytics, enabling the digital initiatives.   The business relation with the Digital team and various group functions and regional reporting functions is a key element of this role.    Responsibilities    • Define the Group BI / Analytics solutions strategy and support the key initiatives in the BI analytics and Master Data area.• Bring IT innovation and functional expertise to support and jointly contribute to the LH digital strategy and roadmap.• Ensure efficient delivery and operation of the related products and services to the LafargeHolcim group.• Ensure project schedule and delivered functionality are in line with the business needs and are delivered at optimum cost while also shaping the future IT ecosystem and technologies to enable the group in its digital journey.• Foster a culture of improving precision of capturing business requirements, quality of service solutions and agile delivery.• Ensure compliance with group Policies, methodologies and standards• Leading a team responsible for BI Analytics and Master Data on group level and manage joint engagement with a virtual team of IT experts in the regions and countries to ensure optimal delivery and support of the portfolio of solutions.• Recruiting, coaching, developing and motivating employees within own area of responsibility and creating a work environment that motivates and allows to retain key personnel required to deliver value adding and innovative IT services across the business• Driving alignment with key stakeholders within IT and other functions    Education/Qualifications    • Graduate degree (Master or PhD) in Business or Management, Computer / Data Science, Mathematical / Engineering or related discipline with an IT focus.• Certifications: ITIL/ IT Service Management PMI®/ PRINCE 2® CMMI®    Experience    • Significant experience (8 years +) in leading a team / organization in charge of the design, development, delivery and support of IT Business intelligence and digital Applications in a global context• Significant experience (5 years +) as IT / technology strategic lead or senior IT architect in the field of business intelligence, big data, data lakes analytics and digital initiatives• Proficient understanding of BI and digital business application landscape and architecture and its integration• Experience in leading multidisciplinary, high performance work teams/groups• Proven track record of tight project/cost control• Experience in analytics solution and strategic industrial / predictive analytics initiative (Logistics, Maintenance, Pricing, Sales…) , direct knowledge of key providers in the segment    Knowledge & Skills    • Ability to lead strategy and product / technology roadmap aligned to business and IT strategies• Knowledge of existing and emerging hardware and software technologies and IT architectures in the field of digital analytics and master data management• Deep knowledge on Artificial Intelligence, Machine learning / Deep Learning , Big data / data lakes and related applications and infrastructure element• Strong competency in SAP BI BO and HANA technology, Power BI and Qlikview/sense , good exposure and knowledge on other similar product on the market.• Ability to champion new initiatives and technologies – “Change Leader”• Strong relationship building and interpersonal skills    Language Requirements   Excellent English (written & spoken) - other languages German or French are a plus   Travel Requirements   15%    Options     Apply for this jobApply Aspire Financial Compliance Solution Architect The Aspire Program is a multi-year program which aims at enabling Roche to be sustainably successful in the future by streamlining and simplifying its business model and systems globally. This includes harmonizing and standardizing processes and global master data, simplifying the system landscape and interfaces, optimizing supply chain to realize efficiencies, digitalizing and automating finance and procurement processes and leveraging SAP’s, industry and available Roche best practices.   The Aspire Financial Compliance Solution Architect is responsible for driving alignment of Financial Compliance template requirements for the Aspire program and for developing and implementing Financial Compliance solutions. This role reports to the Aspire Finance Functional Solution Delivery Lead.   The main responsibilities include:  Support the design, build and oversee the implementation of global financial compliance solutions Ensure the solution fits to the Roche Financial Compliance requirements and the end to end processes including systems, interfaces and platforms Act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME), working closely and aligned with the business process managers (BPMs) and project team members in the Financial Compliance area to find opportunities and drive standardization of master data and processes Collaboration with the Finance IT Lead and project management organization to complete activities and work packages according to the program plan and milestones of the Finance work stream Provide architectural guidance and conceptual design in projects and operations, taking into consideration the technology trends Ensure smooth handover of the solution and system built to the support and operations teams    You have 6+ years of hands on experience in Financial Compliance solutions preferably in Pharma/healthcare industry with excellent Business Process knowledge in the area of Segregation of Duties, DOA (Delegation of Authority), ICFR, Internal Controls and IT General Controls and 3+ years of hands on experience in SAP Finance/Controlling. Knowledge of SAP S/4 HANA and Solution Manager is desirable    Further the following qualifications are required:   Knowledge of Finance business processes and its interdependence with other business areas and Knowledge of Finance Compliance Solution such as SAP GRC, BWISE or other is preferred Familiarity with Project Management Methodology with experience on resource planning Strong analytical thinking, result focused, love to work in teams and ability to prioritize and organize work effectively Proven track record of introducing and delivering innovative solutions in the Financial Compliance area with the ability to manage demanding timelines and operate in a complex environment Experience in managing stakeholder partnerships, focusing on the fundamentals of reliability and credibility. Ability to establish a solid network and work effectively across organizational boundaries C-level fluency in English and preferably conversational German, any additional language is a plus    If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos oncareers.roche.ch/faq    Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.   Display original ad

Digital Solution Architect Digital Solution Architect    Switzerland, Buchs  Reference No: 14288What's the role? You will architect the next generation solution platform for our fleet management customers. This platform will combine elements of smart tools and batteries, digital process, machine learning and predictive maintenance providing new business use cases through a new flexible microservice architecture. Who is Hilti? We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. Hilti is a multicultural workplace with 127 different nationalities committed to global teamwork. Global IT within Hilti is a truly global team with main hubs in Buchs (Switzerland), Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia) and Plano/Tulsa (USA). All locations have highly competent teams who work very closely together. Hilti`s Global IT team is known for their focus on sustainable value creation by translating latest IT innovations into value creating solutions & services. What does the role involve? As an experienced professional, you will develop the architecture of our next generation digital solutions. Based on the “big picture” of the business, you will create architectural approaches for software design and implementation to guide the development team. Specifically, this role will work together with the project team to design a next generation software platform that will deliver technology as a strategic advantage. This new platform will leverage advanced scalable architecture and will absorb latest technologies such as cloud computing, internet of things, machine learning and big data. As part of a global agile working team you will coordinate across different solution verticals and external partners.   From Infrastructure, Communication Technologies, ERP Systems, Mobile Applications, Information Management to fully cloud-based microservice development and Internet of Things – you name it – we do it on a global scale. What do we offer? We give you the autonomy to identify the right technology solutions for our customers. We also encourage you to grow, not only in this role, but also beyond - you will be able to move around the business, to experience various job functions and even work abroad in different markets. Our IT department is located in the mountainous Buchs, Switzerland and is conveniently in walking distance to the train station and in close proximity to our Headquarters in Schaan. We offer you subsidized coupons for the local restaurants as one of the many perks. Additionally Hilti e-bikes are readily available for you to use. We want you to work your best and offering flexible working and day care for your children are just some of the ways we do that. We also offer full time or part time working arrangements (60 -100%). Why should you apply? At Hilti we truly believe in a long-term relationship with our employees. We are committed to support their well-being at work and to accompany them throughout the phases of their personal lives. Next to our competitive compensation package we have many additional benefits like e.g. 20% home office and trust-based flexible working hours, 22 days of annual leave and additional 10 compensation days, sabbatical and parental leave options, and a child day care centre. What you need is:  Master’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related fields Proven several years of experience in a full-time technology role in software development, system integration, cloud computing or enterprise architecture Solution Architecture experience designing and implementing complex enterprise applications Proven business acumen and customer focus providing solutions to add value Demonstrated strong analytical, problem-solving, organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills Fluent in English (verbally and written)    Does that sound like you? Apply today and start your Hilti journey.If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Stefan Bauert on linkedIn, the line manager of this role. https://www.linkedin.com/in/stefanbauert/   Display original ad

Job title: Data Warehouse Engineer - (6 months temporary contract)
Content: Data Warehouse Engineer - (6 months temporary contract)    Position Description                                   Data Warehouse Engineer - (6 months temporary contract)  Job categoryTemporary Employee  GroupFinance, Technology & Operations  LocationGeneva    Apply Now     Data Warehouse Engineer (6 months temporary contract)   The World Economic Forum, committed to improving the state of the world, is the international organization for public-private cooperation. The Forum engages the foremost political, business and other leaders of society to shape global, regional and industry agendas.    Why we are recruiting  The Forum is building world-leading digital collaboration platforms, knowledge and data tools for our constituents. The mission of the Data & Analytics team is to build a scalable and innovative analytics platform to help the Forum achieve its long-term strategic goals. To support this development, we are looking for a smart and energetic Data Warehouse Engineer to help us build these analytical tools. A critical member of the Technology department, the Data Warehouse Engineer will work with the Data Warehouse Architect and the rest of the Data & Analytics team, product engineers and various internal stakeholders to develop the tools that will facilitate the derivation of insights, and help answer complex analytical problems.    Reporting Lines & Interactions  The Data & Analytics team has 6 members equally split between (Data Science, BI/Front-end, DWH/Back-end) and this position fits in the latter, reporting to the Data Warehouse Architect.You will interact with various teams (IT Security, Infrastructure, Digital Success …) within the technology department and with data champions across the Forum.    Breakdown of main responsibilities   40% Creating SSRS reports (SQL/SOQL - Salesforce data extraction & transformation)  20% DWH Design & Development (Redshift)  20% DevOps  10% Innovation & Solutions sourcing  10% Admin & Support (SSRS/DWH/Sisense BI)   The successful candidate will be assessed on   Designing and implementing ETL processes and data-models to build the single source of truth: the Forum’s cloud data warehouse. Designing, building, launching, optimizing and extending full-stack Big Data and business intelligence solutions spanning extraction, storage, transformation and visualization layers. Improving our analytical tools using the latest and greatest innovations from external partners. Partnering with user teams and other engineering/product teams on development, support issues, process issues, bug fixes and delivery of enhancements using an Agile approach. Creating SSRS reports as requested by our internal teams   Preferred Requirements and Experience   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, other technical degree or strong self-taught programming skills. 2+ years of relevant experience in database programming or equivalent practical experience. Experience with BI tools (e.g. Sisense, Tableau, Sportfire …). Experience with data wrangling and working with large datasets and familiar with DWH concepts A solid understanding of technical infrastructure and coding practices (database design, SQL, Python, JavaScript…). Fluency in English Clear documentation skills and the ability to thrive in a complex and fast paced organization. Experience with Machine Learning / Data science a plus  Salesforce.com,Sisense,AWS, SSRS andApacheNifi experience is a plus.   Why work at the Forum  We believe that progress happens by bringing together people from all walks of life who have the drive and the influence to improve the state of the world by building awareness and co-operation,shaping mind-sets and agendas and driving collective action. Join us and become a driver for positive change!  BackShare              Apply Now                    Display original ad

Enterprise Architect - Cloud At Roche, we believe every employee makes a difference. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives. We believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are courageous in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world. We are looking for new innovative Enterprise Architect (EA) and leader to work in our Global Enterprise Architecture Team to develop and maintain Cloud Computing and Management strategies. This includes engaging with a wide range of partners to guide them in making the right investments in technology and innovation. In this role you will provide technology strategy and architecture leadership and direction to the Roche Group worldwide. You will have direct impact on the future direction of Roche Cloud and Compute Infrastructure environment, addressing emerging business needs with innovative application of state-of-the-art capabilities. You will lead the positive cultural change for cloud adoption, develop and coordinate cloud architecture, and develop a cloud strategy and adaptation process.    Your main responsibilities will be:   Deliver clear value-based technology strategies and roadmaps to support our IT Business Partners to dedicatedly respond to digital transformation and disruption Provide insights and input for better decision-making to help build the capabilities required by our IT Partners and consumers of our services Lead and encourage the technology transformation from roadmap to realization by conducting assessments, innovation and prioritizing standards Assess technologies and trends in a methodical way to ensure insights based recommendations that fit the Roche environment. Analyze current technology environment to identify deficiencies and recommending solutions, as well as staying abreast of emerging security technologies and trends and apply them where appropriate Facilitate engagement and foster collaboration with architecture partners to ensure consistency in direction and decision-making     Furthermore, you will:   Create compelling presentations to articulate the technical strategies, architecture and roadmaps to various levels in the organization Work with Roche Science Infrastructure group to define the strategies and principles that guide technology decisions for the enterprise for scientific computing and analysis Support Contract and vendor negotiation for external cloud services (hosting and sourcing), including negotiation, relationship management, tracking, troubleshooting and reporting Consult on technical architecture implementation activities with all partners and Solution Owners to ensure alignment. Handle and work with Engineering on the evaluation and selection of Cloud related technologies and products. Identify the organizational, operational sustainability and financial impacts of defined strategies; analyze gaps to create a risk profile for the proposed strategy.     We believe to be successful in this position you'll need:   A Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience and certified in multiple Cloud areas (desired). Ideally, you have strong business knowledge in the Pharma/Biotech industry and associated processes and you bring the following qualifications: 10 to 15 years of experience in Compute and Cloud infrastructure with medium to large global enterprises with global geographical topologies Deep expertise in scalable and hybrid compute infrastructure design and delivery (including compute, storage, network), hybrid-cloud infrastructures, Cloud Security, Cloud Management Platforms, Data Protection, automation and orchestration frameworks, service-oriented architecture, network development and monitoring, containers Practical experience in cloud adoption, cloud application design, and cloud management and monitoring across public, private and hybrid cloud deployments. Use business knowledge and financial skills to create the business case for cloud deployments, including return on investment and efficiency measures Experienced communication and consulting skills; able to build strong relationships with customers, partners, and infrastructure teams.     What else should be in your toolbox?   Solid experience with Application architecture, integration tools and services, open source languages and tools, open standards Good understanding of security and compliance as related to Cloud, especially data protection and governance Accomplished in framing an enterprise IT architecture, confirmed to deliver robust, secure, scalable, highly available, and dynamic solutions to drive global business objectives Ability to review proposed solution architectures, identify risks and provide remediation recommendations in line with established standards and overall Cloud strategies Effectively engage partners at all levels and promote candid communication in the creation of strategies and roadmaps; able to influence and negotiate with business and IT Partners.    We are searching for someone who is active and influencing in your area of expertise; who is able to act fast and make quick decisions while taking risks. You enjoy challenges, think in opportunities and solutions, not only in threats. You are constantly looking for innovative ways to do things and opportunities for improvement and are able to live in ambiguity while reacting positively in constantly changing business environments. You understand the critical importance of diversity and take advantage to build stronger strategies. Be a great collaborator. Excellent English communication skills and understanding of what information is required by whom, when and how is mandatory.   We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you have questions, please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq. Display original ad

Senior Software Engineer / Architect Jetzt bewerben   Situated in the heart of Zug in Switzerland, which is globally recognized as the Crypto Valley and the home of multifold reputable crypto and blockchain organizations, we have established our headquarter operations. SEBA represents a new digital finance offering, which is committed to security, transparency and performance. Our talented teams build the bridge between the old and new economy and own a wealth of experience in financial markets, regulation, technology and information security. We are bringing a new financial services paradigm to the blockchain and finance economy. In scope of our growth plans we are seeking for an experienced and talented Software Engineer, as part of our Technology team. In this role, you will report directly to our Head of IT Engineering.  In this function you will help to bring SEBA to the next level, to expand our offering and scale globally by embracing cutting edge technology. You will work directly with different business lines to deliver new solutions in an agile fashion. Our team covers the entire life cycle from requirements engineering, solution architecture, implementation, automation testing to devops and closely collaborates with our internal IT Operations, Security, Testing and Crypto teams. As technology experts we are also closely involved in projects delivered by partners, to make sure their deliveries fit with our strategy, high standards and Enterprise Architecture. If you’re keen to provide real business value instantly then don't hesitate to apply for this unique opportunity. You will be involved in projects covering our crypto storage, trading and risk applications, digital process automation as well as data architecture to enable advanced analytics and AI. For you to become part of SEBA’s journey, we require the following set of experience: Must-have  Several years of professional experience in a software engineering or similar role Passion for technology and a continuous learning mindset, staying up to date with the latest developments and trends Java know-how, knowledgeable of its rich open source ecosystem of frameworks and libraries At least another programming language you're comfortable to quickly deliver solutions with All the other necessary tools of the trade such as version control, databases, systems integration through APIs etc. Linux, as that's what runs on your desktop and on the servers you'll deploy to Ability to secure systems, using methods of authentication, authorization and encryption Technical understanding of crypto currencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum (and if you’re new to them, then impress us with how quickly you learn)  Nice-to-have  Kotlin, Python Spring Boot Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes Grafana, Elastic Stack, Prometheus FIX Protocol  At SEBA, our people make the difference. We look forward to receiving your full application (CV, Motivation Letter, Reference Letters and Diplomas). SAP Architect    About Atos  Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with over 110,000 employees in 73 countries and annual revenue of over € 11 billion. European number one in Cloud, Cybersecurity and High-Performance Computing, the Group provides end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications and Digital Workplace solutions. The group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and operates under the brands Atos, Atos Syntel, and Unify. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea), listed on the CAC40 Paris stock index. The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information technology space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education as well as multicultural and pluralistic approaches to research that contribute to scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the group enables its customers, employees and collaborators, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably and confidently in the information technology space. For our B&Ps division based in Zurich or Nyon, we are currently looking for a    SAP Architect    An SAP Solution Architect is the subject matter expert in SAP ERP core functionality (Procurement, Sales, Finance, Inventory, Manufacturing) with business process experience in some business areas like Retail, Machinery, Pharma etc and has a solid overall understanding of integrations between different functions within enterprise solutions. Also responsible for process analysis, business requirements gathering, impact analysis and solution implementations. Proven ability to work well with internal and external business partners is a must. Should know new SAP solution and product trends, understand transformation approaches from old to actual SAP Solutions, understand business benefits due to digital transformation projects. Requires strong communication skills and the ability to build good relationships with key business and IT stakeholders as well as demonstrate leadership by aligning with client business goals.    Your responsibilities   Work with customer architecture team and business users to gather and document business requirements Design and document solutions that fulfil business requirements effectively and efficiently. Takes part in reviews of own work and leads reviews of colleagues’ work Share business values of new SAP solutions to a customer and can prove design and prove new system architecture to achieve business goals Assist business leaders and senior IT management in leading the organization in the identification, evaluation, and selection of SAP solutions using industry best practices. Identify, analyze, and communicate SAP and non-SAP options, making recommendations to management. Effectively communicate to the appropriate audience and build consensus around the recommended solutions Provide organizational change management process as part digital transformation program Proactively gather feedback from the key business users, understand the business and system gaps. Make recommendations and lead implementations for enhancements Work with Project Management team to analyze, design, build, test and implement solutions in a timely manner Collaborate with Service Operations team and contribute to ensure continuous business operations Proactively identify business and system improvements, make recommendations, take ownership and bring those initiatives to successful implementation Lead and provide support to co-workers Provide training and knowledge transfer to others in order to achieve customer and employer goals Create prescriptive examples of new technical approaches (both proof-of-concept and also potentially production ready componentry) to illustrate technology directions or best practices. Provide guidance on the evolution of systems and architectures and the adoption of such technologies that meet specified cost/ benefit criteria. Develop prototypes and conduct recommendations, contract and service level requirements, etc Preform price benchmarks and cost estimation and modelling of various technologies for consideration Collaborate with SAP as vendor to identify opportunities to innovate across the solution. Understand the future SAP roadmap, as well as the current and future needs of the business, and align technology roadmap to deliver upon those needs     Your profile   Experience in configuration of at least 2 SAP ERP core modules (MM, SD, FI, CO, PP) Work with SAP S4 (nice to have) Participation in SAP S4 migration projects (nice to have) Experience in design, development, implementation, testing of IT systems based on SAP solutions 10+ years of experience with SAP Participation in more than 5 projects, including at least 2 in the roles of SA or PM Has SAP certificate (professional level) Strong knowledge of some of core SAP ERP functionality (Procurement, Sales, Manufacturing, Finance) Understanding of all functional areas\modules of SAP ERP Understanding of integration points within SAP ERP Solid knowledge in SAP integration tools Strong knowledge in S4 HANA and understanding differences S4 from SAP ECC Solid practical knowledge in SAP Fiori and new SAP UxD Understanding of main options for SAP ERP integration with other solutions (IDOC, BAPI, OData etc) Excellent skills in SAP Cloud solutions like (Ariba, Success Factors, SCP etc) and integrations Cloud solutions with other SAP products (inc. ECC\S4HANA) Knowledge of SAP Planning and optimization solutions (IBP, APO, BPC) and their role in general SAP architecture Understanding of General SAP solution map Knowledge of SAP roadmap Solid knowledge of SAP project methodologies (ASAP, SAP Activate) and differences between them Experience in work with SAP Solution Manager Understanding of SAP CI\CD approach Understanding of SAP extensions principles and options Strong knowledge of SAP S4 HANA migration\implementation approaches Excellent skills for requirements gathering, solution design, hands-on build, implementation and troubleshooting Ability to work as an individual or in a team environment to develop solutions Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build effective relationships Strong communication skills which include: ability to convey complex technical concepts to company stakeholders in an easy-to-understand manner, both verbally and written; active listening skills to gather key information from internal and external partners Leadership skills: proactively identify opportunities, make recommendations, own initiatives and mentor others Ability to build consensus without authority Keen analytical and problem-solving skills Flexibility to adapt to new processes and technologies quickly Sound time management skills with the ability to multi-task and handle multiple projects/tasks concurrently Proficient in MS Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint Project\opportunity based; up to 50% of domestic or international Language – Fluent English, Fluent French   Your Application If you wish to apply for this position, please click below to complete our online application form and attach your CV in either Word, rtf or text format.Atos does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, age, disability or sexual orientation. All recruitment decisions are based solely on qualifications, skills, knowledge and experience and relevant business requirements.We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the applications process for people with disabilities. Job title: Cloud Engineer / Cloud Architect mit Fokus auf Google Cloud Platform
Content: Cloud Engineer / Cloud Architect mit Fokus auf Google Cloud PlatformSie sind hier:  Home » About us » Jobs und Karriere » Cloud Engineer / Cloud Architect mit Fokus auf Google Cloud Platform Cloud Engineer / Cloud Architect mit Fokus auf Google Cloud Platform  Beginn der Beschäftigung:ab sofort Standort:Olten    Wabion ist der führende Google Cloud Premier Partner im deutschsprachigen Raum mit Büros an den Standorten Olten, Esslingen bei Stuttgart, Köln und Hamburg. Google Cloud ist einer der drei weltweit führenden Public Cloud Provider und einer der zwei mit einem Data Center in der Schweiz. Mit unserer Ausrichtung zeigen wir Gespür für innovative Entwicklungen und Wachstumsmärkte. Mit umfassender Kompetenz und höchstem Qualitätsanspruch führen wir unsere Kunden jeden Tag aufs Neue zum Erfolg.  Die Zukunft der IT liegt in der Cloud und Du möchtest diese mit führenden Technologien von Grund auf mitgestalten? Wir suchen eine/einen   Cloud Engineer / Cloud Architect mit Fokus auf Google Cloud Platform    an unserem Standort in Olten .   Bei uns unterstützt Du grosse Unternehmen auf ihrem Weg in die Cloud – weg von Legacy Systemen hin zu einer modernen Umgebung, mit welcher die Potenziale von echter Cloud realisiert werden. In Zusammenarbeit mit den Kunden gestaltest Du massgeschneiderte Architekturen und Lösungen, führst Migrationen von bestehenden Systemen in die Cloud durch und optimierst bestehende Cloud-Systeme.  Wir bieten interessante, komplexe und abwechslungsreiche Projekte in direkter Zusammenarbeit mit den Kunden sowie mit Google. Wir sind ein internationales, erfolgreiches Unternehmen mit Zukunft und flachen Hierarchien. Deine Kollegen sind ein junges, hoch motiviertes Team mit viel Know-How und Teamgeist, in dem Du Deine kreativen Ideen voll entfalten kannst. Es erwarten Dich flexible Arbeitszeiten in einem Jahresarbeitszeitmodell, moderne Infrastruktur in einem chicen Büro ein paar Minuten vom Bahnhof Olten, Team-Events, Weiterbildungen, Zertifizierungen und vieles mehr.  Du verfügst über folgende Qualifikationen und Eigenschaften       Hochschulabschluss (Fachhochschule, Universität) oder vergleichbar Erfahrung im Bereich IT-Infrastruktur (Virtualisierung, Netzwerk, Sicherheit, Identity and Access Management) Verhandlungssicher in Deutsch und Englisch  Folgende Erfahrungen sind gewünscht, werden aber nicht verlangt. Entsprechend stellen sie auch mögliche Entwicklungspfade dar:  DevOps, Docker, Istio und Kubernetes Infrastructure as Code (IaC) und Scripting Hybride Architekturen und Cloud Migrationen Projektmanagement und Kundenbetreuung   Wir freuen uns auf Dich  Deine Bewerbungsunterlagen sendest Du bitte per E-Mail an: hr@wabion.ch  Für Vorabfragen steht Dir Michael Gomez unter +41 44 552 14 54 gerne zur Verfügung. Für diese Stelle akzeptieren wir nur Direktbewerbungen.  Email senden Display original ad

Hybrid IT Solution Architect (f/m/d)    Hewlett Packard Enterprise(HPE) advances the way people live and work. We bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions, helping our customers make their mark on the world. At Hewlett Packard Enterprise, our mission is to make Hybrid IT simple yet powerful, and we have the expertise to make it happen. Our new innovative IT services organization is HPE Pointnext.We have the expertise to advise, integrate, and accelerate our customers’ outcomes from their digital transformation.   To expand our fast growing business area within HPEwe are looking for Hybrid IT Solution Architects with these    Responsibilities:    Design and implementation of hybrid cloud solutions for enterprise customers in an international environment.   Collaborate with the HPE project team and customer representatives.   Develop and implementation of new cloud installations, designs, and migrations procedures.   Provide advanced technical consulting and advice to others on proposal efforts, solution design, system management, tuning and modification of solutions.   Collect and determine data from appropriate sources to assist in determining customer needs and requirements.   Assess of specific technologies, strategies and implementation.   Identify and address technical or operational risks.      Education and Experience Required    Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent experience.   Typically 5 to 10 years industry experience.   Real life experience in Hybrid IT project delivery, including the solution design.      Knowledge and Skills    Enterprise technical consulting experience.   Experience on Hybrid IT technology / environment   Knowledge of one or more Cloud related solutions such as AWS, VMware, Openstack, Azure/Azure Stack,Kubernetes, Docker,Ansible, Chef, Puppet etc.   Ideally Multi-Cloud Experience.   Expertise in at least some of the following domains (Certifications are preferred):   Cloud deployment models (public, hybrid, private) understanding and Hybrid Cloud Management.   Cloud services and technologies (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, CaaS) with emphasizes on portal and automation tools.   Automation and Orchestration tools experience, Security, networking, monitoring and operations knowledge.     Ability to understand the customer's technical requirement or opportunity and to implement an IT solution that appropriately addresses the technical needs.   Good customer influence and negotiation skills.   Teamwork in a consultancy team in the completion of technical architectures and implementations.   Understands and applies information system or operational solution related modeling methods and tools.   Can validate/evaluate if an information system meets technical requirements and specifications.      Business Acumen   Identifies risks and challenges that occurred in similar projects with other customers. Developed technical specifications that reflect customer requirements in the technology. Ability to gain knowledge of how industry uses IT to address technical challenges such as technical standards and infrastructure, trends and roadmaps. Able to design and present impact messages to customers management level German and English speaking and writing skills.           We offer:   • A competitive salary and extensive social benefits   • Diverse and dynamic work environment   • Work-life balance and support for career development   • An amazing life inside the element! Want to know more about it?   Then let’s stay connected!    https://www.facebook.com/HPECareers     https://twitter.com/HPE_Careers     1043483 HPE is an equal opportunity employer/Female/Minority/Individual with Disabilities/Protected Veteran Status Display original ad

Senior Data Scientist 80-100%Your job.  You will take on technical leadership of customer projects (establishing the methodical approach, developing use cases with the customer, advising customers on technical questions as well as presenting and explaining results). You will manage the development of machine learning pipelines or develop these yourself: data preparation, modelling, method selection, validation. You will evaluate the technical and economic feasibility of machine learning solutions and operationalise concepts from successful prototypes in collaboration with data platform architects. As an expert, you will also assist with the acquisition of customer projects as part of an interdisciplinary bid team. Your talent.  You have at least 4 years of professional/research experience in the area of machine learning since graduation. Experience of implementing projects in industry and services is an advantage. You have very good, broad-based knowledge of machine learning, advanced skills in an application domain (e.g. NLP, CV) and good knowledge of statistics. You are proficient in an ecosystem suitable for data analysis (Python preferred), have experience in software development and are familiar with the concepts of database systems (relational/NoSQL). Thanks to your confident manner in your communications with customers, and your strong personal motivation and passion for data science, you will take on responsibility for projects and the future development of our ML/DA competence. You have a degree from a federal technical institute or university in computer science or mathematics, or a comparable qualification. A PhD in an area related to machine learning is a plus. Excellent German and English language skills are required for this role. And Zühlke. Develop your talent in a highly qualified environment: Zühlke offers you a wide range of opportunities for knowledge exchange and networking plus the security of a long-standing success story. You can develop your career individually, as we will offer you four weeks of further training per year, training camps and active knowledge sharing among experts. Would you like to find out more? Then read our Success Stories or join the conversation on our Zühlke Blog.  Please submit a complete application including CV, cover letter, reference letters, and educational certificates. Provided you are a non-EU/EFTA citizen, we can only accept your application, if a valid Swiss work permit is enclosed.  Display original ad

Job title: Solution Architect - Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Solu Eng
Content: Solution Architect - Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Solu Eng   Back to Previous Page     Job ID277333BR  Position TitleSolution Architect – Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Solu Eng    Apply to Job    Job Description 35 bots live and 100s in the pipeline! As part an innovative multidisciplinary IT team in Novartis, you will part of the integral talent in collaborative innovative and agile teams that experiment, rapidly incubate, and establish to scale digital platforms that deliver value to Novartis in areas like Process Automation, Cognitive Computing (AI, ML), Natural Language Processing, etc. Major accountabilities Accountable to define machine learning solution architecture and engineering of identified automation problems/domains. • Understand technology and infra constraints (eg: models, efficacy, data etc.) to conceptualize solutions within tight constraints of time & technology.• Elaborate and describe the solution architecture holistically (i.e. considering all relevant viewpoints (e.g. functional Architecture, Data Architecture, Technical Architecture, Security Architecture, Performance Architecture, etc.). Elaborate the solution architecture for a specific solution based on architecture-significant requirements and company-wide architecture standards.• Prove fit-for purpose of selected architecture by designing and building proof-of-concept solutions independently but in accordance with established architecture patterns.• Validate solution architectures of the machine learning automation solutions regarding their adequacy and adherence to requirements and standards throughout the solution lifecycle.• Track performance of the model/product once live and iterate the design of the machine learning models to achieve needed efficacy.• Work with Delivery teams/BEF/Business SMEs to give inputs regarding the right end-to-end operating model for ML-solutions.• Own support for product technology related issues to project and operations teams• Define how the different solution components will need to interact and enable their implementation by the delivery teams.        Minimum requirements • Masters in Computer Science/Machine Learning/Statistics or equivalent areas• Fluent in English, other languages beneficial• Hands-on, passionate technologist with a ‘maker mindset’.• At least 8-10 years total experience in IT in which at least 3-4 years is with designing and implementing AI/ML/NLP solutions• Experience with using pre-configured ML services out of Azure/AWS to build out solutions.• Experience building and deploying ground up ML models with Linear/Logistic Regression, Decision trees, Naive Bayes, Random Forest etc.• Proficiency with one or more of the leading deep learning software packages: TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, or MXNet• Global Mindset and communication skills; stakeholder influencing skills• Experience and capability to work with different internal and external roles in a matrix organizational setup WHY CONSIDER NOVARTIS?750 million. That’s how many lives our products touch. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives? We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are empowered to ask new questions, make bolder decisions and take smarter risks. We are Novartis. Join us and help us reimagine medicine.
