Job title: Technical / Program Architects, Salesforce Customer Success Group EMEA
Content:
Technical / Program Architects, Salesforce Customer Success Group EMEA 
        Job CategoryCustomer Success Group    Job Details  Technical / Program Architects, Salesforce Customer Success Group EMEA    Salesforce CSG (Customer Success Group) are a team of trusted advisers, partners, and experts crucial to the success of our customers. We help customers unleash the full power of Salesforce, find and implement technical solutions, and provide guidance on how to build new products for our clients’ needs.   Our EMEA team is growing and we are looking for architects to join us across multiple countries. We hire into two distinct roles, each working with and adding value to customers in different ways.   We can consider your application for both opportunities and advise you on what may be more suitable and best for you.    Technical Architects, part of our EMEA Delivery Business  Technical Architects collaborate with our customers and partners during project planning and implementation to share their comprehensive knowledge of the Salesforce platform and product suite. Combined with their previous experience in technical architecture, enterprise integration, and business solution implementation, they directly drive toward the best possible business solutions that meet and exceed our customers' needs. They paint a solution vision, architect both the system and the implementation approach, and then watch it change the status quo. Responsibilities   · Lead the evaluation of business and technical requirements; review and guide project vision and direction, implementation approach and key artifacts; direct early solution evaluation around gaps/risks, including the pro-active management of issues and effective engagement with executives, the Account Team, Engineering, and Product Management · Direct and mentor diverse teams of resources in technical delivery aspects (customer, partner, colleagues), especially where the TSA does not have direct authority over all resources and must carefully consider communication strategies, executive influence, differing or conflicting goals, and other similar non-technical challenges · Identify and lead or contribute to internal strategic initiatives to grow the consulting practice and IP/toolsets, Strategic Services brand, and teammates' skill sets  · Build relationships with business partners, internal and external; contribute to broader goals and growth beyond the scope of a single or your current project   Experience/Skills Required   · Extensive hands-on technical consulting and solution implementation experience, including with one or more common enterprise software solutions (e.g. CRM, ERP), demonstrating positions of increasing responsibility and management/mentoring of more junior technical resources; experience with Waterfall and/or Agile implementation methodologies · Proven ability to analyze, design, and optimize business processes via technology and integration, including leadership in guiding customers and colleagues in rationalizing and deploying emerging technology for business use cases · A thorough understanding of web services, data modeling, and enterprise application integration concepts, including experience with enterprise integration tools (ESBs and/or ETL tools), and common integration design patterns with enterprise systems (e.g. CMS, ERP, HRIS, DWH/DM) · Demonstrably excellent, context-specific and adaptive communication and presentation skills across a variety of audiences and situations; established habit of proactive thinking and behavior and the desire and ability to self-start/learn and apply new technologies  Program Architect, part of our EMEA Advisory Business    Program Architects play a critical role within Salesforce Services, serving as a strategic advisor and Salesforce product and platform expert to the company’s largest, most complex enterprise customers. They will typically work with one customer at a time, engaging at C-level and driving conversations with our customer’s enterprise architects and business stakeholders armed with best practices for enterprise architecture functions such as security, performance, development process, and application governance.   Responsibilities   · Advise and mentor diverse teams, which include customer and partner resources in technical and functional delivery aspects at a program level, using influence and adaptive communication strategies in scenarios where Senior Architect does not have direct authority over all resources. · Contribute to a program vision while advising and articulating program/project strategies on enabling technologies · Provide guidance on application and integration development best practices, Enterprise Architecture standards, functional and technical solution architecture & design, environment management, testing, and Platform education · Drive the creation of application and technical design documents which leverage best practices and effectively integrate Salesforce into the customer’s infrastructure · Troubleshoot key customer implementation issues and demonstrate ability to drive to successful resolution. Lead the evaluation of business and technical requirements from a senior level · Review and correcting project/program direction, approach and key artifacts to keep programs on track and solutions extendable and maintainable going forward · Identification and pro-active management of risk areas and commitment to seeing an issue through to complete resolution · Manage customer expectations; negotiate solutions to complex problems with both the customer and third-party partners · Build relationships with business partners, internal and external, and contributing to broader goals and growth beyond the scope of a single customer engagement Experience/Skills Required   · Extensive enterprise consulting experience, including implementation experience with one or more common enterprise software solutions (e.g. CRM, ERP), filling positions of increasing responsibility and management of more junior technical resources · Experience as a Senior Architect and/or CTO in a mid to large sized organization with demonstrated leadership driving an organizational transformation in a matrixed organization.  · Experience with key areas of enterprise architecture, including integration technologies, single sign on, and master data management · Ability to work independently and be a self-starter. Proven results leading and overseeing customer and/or partner success stories in the following domains: front- and back-end solution architecture, development and release management strategies, change management, and direct leadership in designing solutions that meet or exceed customer needs. · Proven ability to analyze, design, and optimize business processes via technology and integration   Also   · Please note our CSG business is a consulting organisation largely working onsite with our customers. Depending on your location, business needs and customer expectations, the need for travel can vary substantially · We can in certain circumstances consider applicants without local language skills, but is our strong preference to hire employees speaking business level local language(s) and English     About Salesforce  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes's "World's Most Innovative Company" five years in a row and one of Fortune's "100 Best Companies to Work For" eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.   *LI-Y           Posting Statement   Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.      Display original ad

Digital Biomarker Mobile Solutions Architect  Are you ready to apply your creativity and mobile solutions design skills to transform the way new medicines are developed and to be at the frontier of personalized medicine? Roche’s Digital Biomarkers team is looking for a creative and aspiring mobile solutions designer/architect to help us move forward in the new era of healthcare, where for us this is more than a job. It’s helping to change the world.     Roche Digital Biomarkers is a multi-disciplinary team within Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) Informatics. Here, a group of talented and passionate colleagues are working on ground-breaking research to shed new light on diseases and ultimately improve development of new drugs for millions of patients. The Digital Biomarkers Technical Team designs and develops end-to-end technical ecosystems enabling digital science for a range of diseases, including Multiple Sclerosis and Parkinson's Disease. Patient facing applications that run on smartphones and wearables are being designed and developed specifically for clinical studies to support novel ways of conducting research.    The Position  As a Mobile Solutions Designer/Architect, you will be working with disease specialists, clinical researchers, software product managers and data analysts to enable innovation in the clinical space that will allow patients to get better treatments in the future. In this role, you will be i) designing and architecting digital biomarker mobile apps collecting high frequency sensor data, ii) translating new product requirements into re-usable mobile solutions features which can be added to the Digital Biomarkers mobile solutions platform, and iii) drive and contribute to end-to-end design and architecture for the Digital Biomarkers mobile solutions platform.   This position requires a passionate and experienced mobile solutions designer/architect with strong technical and interpersonal skills to handle responsibilities including:     Designing and prototyping new innovative features for digital biomarker applications     Coordinating and contributing to design and architectural work carried out by a group of Scientific Technical Managers and Mobile Developers     Identifying and developing innovative ideas for highly engaging patient facing mobile sensor apps     Providing guidance and direction to mobile development project teams      Who You Are  You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company where you receive the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Working in a multicultural environment motivates you. As a fast learner you actively drive the quality of the requirements.   Key qualifications:     MSc level or above in computer science, business informatics or a related field     5+ years designing and developing Android and/or iOS applications     3+ years leading software development teams     Proven track record of designing innovative mobile solutions      Strong conceptual thinker     Ability to analyze product requirements and translate into practical and re-usable designs for mobile solutions     Deep understanding of core Computer Science concepts     Strong object-oriented design and programming skills     Ability to work well in a multi-disciplinary team and communicate clearly to different stakeholders     Quality mindset and great attention to detail       Helpful links illustrating recent work in our program team:     Digital Biomarker Program overview:    https://isctm.org/public_access/Autumn2018/Presentation/Gossens-Aut18.pdf      Schizophrenia:    https://isctm.org/public_access/Autumn2018/PDFs/Umbricht-Poster.pdf      Parkinson’s Disease:    https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/mds.27376     http://www.nature.com/nature/outlook/parkinsons-disease/pdf/roche.pdf     http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v538/n7626_supp/full/538S8a.html      Huntington’s Disease:    http://curehd.blogspot.com/2018/03/roche-gears-up-for-pivotal-phase-3.html      Multiple Sclerosis:    https://floodlightopen.com     https://www.btcalgary.ca/video/iframe/2226196965001/SkX1bBGY/5838106745001     https://www.roche.com/de/media/releases/med-cor-2018-10-02.htm     https://www.futuremedicine.com/doi/pdf/10.2217/nmt-2017-0054     https://www.roche.com/media/store/releases/med-cor-2017-10-27.htm     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6BPS5tl2RRc     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k8XulS3IxBc      If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients’ lives. If you want to work in a passionate team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now.   Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.   If you have questions, please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.  Display original ad

ICT Architect 80% bis 100%    Was du bewegstDu planst und baust unsere Netze mit dem Ziel, technisch und wirtschaftlich zu den Besten zu gehören. Auch sorgst du dafür, dass sie stabil und sicher laufen. Falls mal etwas schiefläuft, suchst, analysierst und behebst du den Fehler. Ausserdem betreust du unsere internen und externen Kunden bei technischen Anliegen. Im Incident-Fall unterstützt du uns, Störungen zu beheben. Dein Wissen teilst du gerne mit anderen. Bei Bedarf übernimmst du bei einzelnen Projekten die technische Teilprojektleitung im Bereich Netzwerk. Hierfür koordinierst du Termine und Ressourcen und wirkst – wenn nötig – steuernd.  Weshalb dir das gelingt  Abschluss (FH/TS) in Informatik, Telekommunikation, Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbar Fundierte, praktische Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Internet, TCP/IP, Routing und Switching sowie Security Vertraut mit der Entwicklung und dem Betrieb komplexer Netzwerke (Cisco) Kenntnisse in IT-Security (Firewall), Datacenter (Network) und Load Balancing (F5) von Vorteil Cisco-Zertifizierung als Professional von Vorteil Faible für neue Technologien und Teamarbeit Sehr gutes Deutsch und Englisch, Französisch von Vorteil       Neugierig auf mehr?Als ICT Architect ... startest du so rasch wie möglich ... arbeitest du im Team vor Ort ... reist du bis zu 30% deiner Arbeitszeit innerhalb der Schweiz   Diese Stelle möchten wir ohne externe Personaldienstleister besetzen.   KontaktJürg +41 58 223 34 65   Job Nummer6555 KonzerneinheitSwisscom Broadcast AG   Weitere Stellen    ICT Application Engineer     ICT Architect Data Center     Cloud System Engineer     Senior Security Engineer  Alle offenen Stellen      Was dich erwartet   Faire Arbeitsbedingungen    Faire Arbeitsbedingungen Du profitierst von den fortschrittlichen Anstellungsbedingungen des Swisscom Gesamtarbeitsvertrages (GAV). Fringe Benefits Wir offerieren dir einen monatlichen grosszügigen Rabatt auf bestimmte Swisscom Produkte. Zudem profitierst du von vergünstigten Tickets und Abonnements des öffentlichen Verkehrs. Ein weiterer Vorteil: In unseren Personalrestaurants kannst du dich gesund und für wenig Geld verpflegen.    Faire Arbeitsbedingungen Du profitierst von den fortschrittlichen Anstellungsbedingungen des Swisscom Gesamtarbeitsvertrages (GAV). Wir bezahlen einen fairen, marktgerechten Lohn und belohnen zusätzlich gute Leistungen. Unser Lohnsystem ist transparent.   Grosszügige Sozialleistungen Swisscom bietet dir über die Pensionskasse comPlan eine gut ausgebaute Altersvorsorge mit individuell wählbaren Sparvarianten. Bei Krankheit oder Unfall gewähren wir dir eine grosszügige Lohnfortzahlung.   Arbeitswelt Bei Swisscom wird Innovation und kontinuierliche Verbesserung aktiv gefördert und von dir mitgestaltet. Wir arbeiten in interdisziplinären Teams. Co-working, Prototyping und agile Arbeitsmethoden sind fester Bestandteil unserer Kultur.   Flexibel arbeiten Mit der Möglichkeit zu Gleitzeit, Teilzeit oder Jobsharing unterstützen wir dich dabei, Arbeit und Privatleben gut unter einen Hut zu bringen. Und weil Reisen den Horizont erweitert, kannst du entweder unbezahlten Urlaub beantragen oder pro Jahr bis zu zwei Wochen zusätzliche Ferien kaufen. CIT Enterprise Architect 100% (f/m/d)  Ihre Aufgaben    The Mettler Toledo Business is enabled by a powerful information engine. CIT acts as a business partner and value creator by combining process, data, change management and technical expertise to support, enable and optimize business processes.    This is a newly created position where you enjoy a high degree of room to manoeuvre.For this interesting and versatile position we are looking for a CIT Enterprise Architect 100% (f/m/d) In this role, your responsibilities would include:   Define opportunities to create business value and identify the required capabilities to realize them  Based on the divisional strategy, you identify future IT capabilities and assess their feasibility in terms of architecture, technology and services  Develop and maintain IT roadmap, architectural principles, standards, policies and solution governance  Drive smarter technology investments by driving changes in application, infrastructure, process and IT tools architecture  Define long-term target state for each layer and translate it into a roadmap  Requirements collection and translation into valuable concepts and specifications  Survey of the current architecture and development of target architectures, gap analyses and roadmaps     Ihr Profil  Following requirements are necessary for this role:   Master/ Bachelor degree in Informatics, Computer Science or equivalent with at least 5 years of experience in IT tools architecture & designing IT solutions if possible gained in a global manufacturing company Strong knowledge of architecture frameworks, concepts and best practices with distinctive strategic planning capabilities You are a networker with excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate at different management levels. You are able to motivate people in matrix organization and to get things done You have a good sense for business opportunities Leading figure between IT and business, Stakeholder Management (Global Process Owners, system owner on business side) Fluent in German and English Readiness to travel globally (20%)      Unser Angebot  Are you interested to work within a dynamic organization with strong opportunities for advancement? We are looking forward to your online application!   Mettler-Toledo GmbHFabio Ambrosone Acquisition ManagerHR Talent Acquisition SwitzerlandIm Langacher 448606 Greifensee www.mt.com      Über Mettler Toledo METTLER TOLEDO is a leading global supplier of precision instruments and services. We are recognized as an innovation leader and our solutions are critical in key R&D, quality control, and manufacturing processes for customers in a wide range of industries including life sciences, food, and chemicals. We operate throughout the world with a culture shaped by innovation and international flair.   Chancengleichheit We promote equal opportunity worldwide and value diversity in our teams in terms of business background, area of expertise, gender and ethnicity. For more information on our commitment to Sustainability, Diversity and Equal Opportunity please visit us here.
