SD-WAN Technical Solutions Architect    Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today, but could open in the near future. When you apply, a Cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.            Who You’ll Work With      As part of the Enterprise Networking Sales team, you will join a dynamic and fun atmosphere to deliver your value to our customers, partners and Cisco. We work hard, play hard and have fun doing it! We take pride in our work and our collective success is dependent upon teamwork, both internally and externally, and selling in a matrixed environment requires a customer-first approach all the while establishing an outcome where everybody wins environment for the reseller partner as well as Cisco. Passion, Integrity, Trust, Leadership, Discipline and Execution are our values and we need to ensure our employees possesses these traits.            What You’ll Do       Work closely with theatre and global sales leadership to support sales in a strategic and tactical manner     Build and manage a functional technical sales organization to support the company vision and sales objectives     Develop and implement objectives and personal growth plans to ensure continuous leadership within the technical sales organization     Work in a cross-functional team with representatives from product management, engineering and other organizations to spur innovation and development of the existing and future product sets.     Develop sales and technical collateral, such as presentations, white papers, design guides and test plans for furthering internal and external knowledge along with sales.     Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills to manage interactions with customers, partners and other important parties     Work with partners to facilitate technical sales enablement, tender and opportunity assistance and joint sales calls     Keep current on new developments in information technology through conferences and other interactions with industry leaders             Who You Are      As the technical face of the Enterprise Networking sales organization, you will find and engage in new opportunities while also nurturing strong long-term customer relationships. You will establish a need for the SD-WAN solution on a technical and to some extent commercial basis, drive discussions around SD-WAN technology at director level and downwards. You will conduct and drive architectural and technology workshops and own and execute proof-of-concept undertakings to influence technical decision makers. You will conduct training sessions, presentations and write customer solution documents. You will work closely with partners to establish solution preference and participate in joint customer calls and partner events, both internal and customer facing. We will look to you to provide feedback to the product management and sales leadership teams on improvements and new features based on customer feedback and general market/industry requirements. You are expected to work off of broad-based industry experience covering multiple different technology verticals.      You hold a Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field or equivalent     You have technical or professional experience related to the design, installation, and maintenance of local and wide area network required.     You are a seasoned TSA with at least ten years of related work experience, and a minimum of five years of experience installing and maintaining local and wide area networks required.     You possess documentable knowledge of local and wide area networks; computer software and hardware; knowledge of data communications, network planning and analysis; and vendor evaluations.     You demonstrate strong analytical skills and effective social and communication skills to interact with a wide range of individuals at different levels in an organization.     You have the ability to address technical or sales related problems in a timely manner.     You have experience in management and organization building with multi-functional skills taking care of technical and sales matters in a similar position     You must be fluent in English and, ideally, in French and German.              Why Cisco      At Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.     Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.      We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.     We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.     We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.      Colourful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco     We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.      Display original ad

Enterprise Architect, Health & Life Sciences 
        Job CategorySales    Job Details   Salesforce, the Intelligent Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us! As an Industry Enterprise Architect, no two days are the same. You are a valued team member, collaborator, contributor and thought leader who will spend the majority of your time helping our customers on their digital transformation journey. This said, a typical day may start with a team call where you share experiences and expertise with your colleagues in the EA team. You will then start work on a presentation with the CIO of a major industrial manufacturer, using assets from the vast Salesforce repository as well as using your own creativity and insights to prepare a compelling and achievable view of their future. After lunch with colleagues from across the different business functions in our amazing Paris office you will participate in an Equality workshop aligned with one of the 10 Equality Group within Salesforce. The afternoon will be spent presenting our industry point of view to the Chief Digital Officer of a prospective account and debating new trends in AI. Before you head home, you check in for your flight to Barcelona the next day where you will be running enablement sessions for 200 sales and pre-sales colleagues at an internal industry summit.  Job description:  The Solution Engineering Industry Enterprise Architect will act as an enterprise domain expert to sales teams on the Salesforce Customer Success Platform and how it fits into an enterprise business and IT architecture. With a broad IT background including: business architecture, technical architecture, software/systems engineering, cloud computing, and the software development process (SDLC), the Enterprise Architect will structure the proposed deployment of Salesforce solutions and transform customer business strategy into execution. The Industry Enterprise Architect is a subject matter expert in one or more categories that may include: business strategy, application architecture, data & information, integration, security, cloud computing, technology, distributed platforms, mobile, and analytics. The Industry Enterprise Architect will help determine which Salesforce technologies to leverage in customer driven architectures leveraging Enterprise Architecture frameworks and Salesforce agile methodologies. The Industry Enterprise Architect will help the sales teams and customers design specific product roadmaps against business strategies. As a preference, the Industry Enterprise Architect should have a strong industry alignment and knowledge with the Health and Life Sciences industries. The individual should have a strong industry point of view, able to discuss future trends and challenges and provide a Salesforce perspective on how these will be addressed.The Industry Enterprise Architect should have an strong industry alignment and knowledge across several disciplines.  She or he should be comfortable discussing and demonstrating all aspects of the Salesforce platform and advanced skills including our cloud computing infrastructure, integration and declarative/programmatic extensions to business IT audiences including the CTO/CIO and Chief Digital Officers. With a strong blend of technical and sales skills the Enterprise Architect uses a consultative approach to understand business and technical requirements and to help the sales teams develop and refine a technical sales strategy and Salesforce solution fit. The Industry Enterprise Architect will also participate in the delivery of solution and best practices educational sessions to existing customers and the broader Application Platform as a Service (PaaS) and data analytics market.  Experience/Skills Required:   Extensive work experience in the technology sector, either as a vendor or user Strong pre-sales/business development experience from a software vendor, Systems Integrator or other consulting organisation A good understanding of the architectural principles of cloud based platforms including SaaS, PaaS, multi-tenancy, multi-tiered infrastructure and application servers. Familiarity with major cloud offerings in the market and ability to discuss cloud architectures A good understanding of enterprise application integration, for example SOA, ESB, EAI, ETL environments and an understanding of integration considerations such as process orchestration, customer data integration and master data management.     Additional Skills (useful but not required):   Previous practitioner and/or implementation experience of Salesforce solutions or relevant solutions Previous development experience (Force.com, Java or C#, JavaScript, HTML, XML, AJAX, or relevant open source platforms) Enterprise architecture certification such as TOGAF Experience in the Enterprise Architect role in an organisation within the Consumer Goods industry An understanding of UI/UIX design thinking Architectural and development experience of Web Services and emerging solutions such as mobile Principles of network, application and information security A good understanding of the security processes, standards & issues involved in multi-tier, multi-tenant web applications.    Extensive product and personal training and development is provided, both as part of an initial 6 month ramp process and as part of Salesforce’s commitment to continuous learning and employee growth.   LI-Y*         Posting Statement   Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.      Display original ad

Network Security Architect / Security Manager Atos ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter für die digitale Transformation mit 110.000 Mitarbeitern in 73 Ländern und einem Jahresumsatz von 11 Milliarden Euro. Als europäischer Marktführer für Cloud, Cybersecurity und High Performance Computing bietet die Atos Gruppe Unternehmen mit ihrer Digital Transformation Factory End-to-End-Lösungen für Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business-Anwendungen und Digital Workplace. Hinzu kommen Services der Tochtergesellschaft Worldline, dem europäischen Marktführer für Zahlungsverkehrs- und Transaktionsdienste. Mit innovativen Technologien und tiefgreifendem Branchenwissen begleitet Atos die digitale Transformation von Kunden aus allen Branchen. Der Konzern ist der weltweite IT-Partner der Olympischen und Paralympischen Spiele. Atos firmiert unter den Marken Atos, Atos Syntel und Unify. Atos ist an der Pariser Börse als eine der 40 führenden französischen Aktiengesellschaften (CAC40) notiert. Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter www.atos.net     Ihre Aufgaben:  • Engineering von Netzwerk und Security Architekturen und Erarbeitung von Detailkonzepten• Erstellen von Offerten und Mithilfe bei Kundenausschreibungen• 3 rd Level Troubleshooting Support im Bereich Netzwerk und Security• Engineering und Installationen von Security Komponenten (Firewall)• Security Management in Kundenprojekten (Security Officer Aufgaben)• In Zusammenarbeit mit dem Kunden neue Sicherheitsmassnahmen für die Projekte ausarbeiten und diese implementieren• Weiterentwicklung und Mitarbeit bei Pre-Sales Aufgaben im Cyber Security Bereich• Erstellen der notwendigen Dokumentation in Englisch und/oder Deutsch.     Ihr Profil:  • Technischer Uni oder Fachhochschulabschluss (FH)• Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich IP Networking und IT-Security• CISSP Zertifizierung von Vorteil• Cisco Certified CCNA R/S , CCNA Security oder CCNP• 2 Jahre Erfahrung in der Administration / Installation von Checkpoint Firewall Cluster-Lösungen• Sehr gute Kenntnisse im Bereich IT-Security (CAS Information Security)• Kenntnisse im Bereich ISO Standard 27001 und ISMS Aufgaben• Selbstständiger und zielorientierter Arbeitsstil mit einem hohen Maß an Teamfähigkeit• Umfassende technische Expertise zu Cisco Routern, Switches, Firewalls und Netzwerk Produkten anderer Hersteller• Stetige Weiterentwicklung im Bereich Netzwerk, Security und Cyber Security• Gute Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch sehr Vorteilhaft   Ihre Bewerbung    Nutzen Sie die Chance und bewerben Sie sich auf diese spannende und vielseitige Funktion über unsere Karriereseite. Bitte beachtern Sie, dass wir nur vollständige Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Anschreiben, Lebenslauf) im Auswahlprozess berücksichtigen können. Wir freuen uns auf Sie!   Wir haben uns zum Ziel gesetzt, Diversität in unserem Unternehmen zu fördern. Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung, unabhängig von Geschlecht, Herkunft, Alter, Behinderung oder sexueller Orientierung.   Display original ad

Job title: Solution Architect (m/f) for Web Portal Solutions & Digital Transformation
Content: Solution Architect (m/f) for Web Portal Solutions & Digital Transformation       Who does not only want to participate in digital developments, but mainly wants to actively shape transformations, needs primarily one talent – make a difference with passion! We at proaxia want to make the difference for our customers and partners by creating value as promised. Solution Architect for Web Portal Solutions & Digital Transformation proaxia consulting group is a growing and very successful management and technology consultancy with Swiss roots. We are more than 200 consultants and technology experts who work from our subsidiaries in Switzerland, Germany, Poland, Japan, China, Singapore and Indonesia. proaxia's discrete industries’ practice is delivering digital solutions in the marketing, sales and service area for discrete manufacturers. With our deep understanding and passion for excellence we bridge the gap between innovative business models and the right technological support. Do you also want to make a difference and be at the forefront in digital transformation in discrete industries? Are you inspired by the latest business models and innovations through web technologies and cloud architectures? Are you a talented solution architect and passionate to bring modern technologies into life? And do you have entrepreneurial spirit and like to create value? Then join our management consulting team as the solution architect! Areas of interest  Industries: Discrete industries, Mechanical engineering, Manufacturing, Healthcare, Medical instruments & devices, Automotive, High-tech, Building industries Processes: After-market, Customer service, Field service, After-sales (logistics), Sales, Marketing Technologies: (Web / enterprise) portals, E-commerce, Web shops, Cloud, Data integration, Web content management, Digital asset management, Digital marketing automation, Mobile (Responsive Design, iOS, Android), Social media, Connected products Solutions: SAP Hybris Commerce, SAP Cloud Platform Portal Service, YaaS Hybris-as-a-Service, SAP Hybris Sales & Services, SAP ECC SD / MM / CS Countries: Germany, Switzerland and world-wide within our customer projects  Your responsibilities  You ensure the realization of our customers' digital tranformation journeys You translate complex business and technology requirements into appropriate solution designs and technology concepts You analyze, design and specificy holistic solution architectures that optimize and enhance our customer's sales and service processes You ensure the realization of our customers’ digital transformation journeys  You communicate clearly and precisely to the respective stakeholder groups and orchestrate the teams of our customers, third party partners and proaxia colleagues You support business development of our web portal consulting services  You work independently and take full responsibility    You enjoy participating acquisition and bidding as digital expert in pre-sales     Your qualifications & work experiance   Above-average university degree (Univ. / FH) in computer science, information systems, information management, business administration, mechanical engineering or other equivalent technical disciplines with management background   Very good analytical and conceptual skills strengthened with a strong methodological background and to be executed in a well-structured approach   High affinity to provide digital experiences to our customers in business and IT   Understanding of state-of-the-art business models and processes in the customer service and after-market area   Multi-year practical experience in business consulting and software development projects   Excellent Architecture expertise, from Enterprise Architecture Management over Solution Architectures to System and Technology Architecture concepts    Broad experience with Portal technologies like SAP Hybris Commerce, SAP Enterprise Portal, Salesforce Communities, IBM Websphere, Liferay, etc., and their integration (e.g. WS, JSON, REST, SOAP, XML, RFC, IDoc)   Advanced knowledge in current web development technologies and frameworks like Java, Spring Framework, JQuery, AngularJS, Node.js, SAP UI5 etc. is preferred   General understanding of cloud technologies and platforms, such as SAP Cloud Platform, YaaS, Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS etc. is preferred   Experience in design thinking and customer journey methodology is a plus   Experience with agile requirements engineering and software development concepts, such as Scrum, user stories, DevOps, continuous integration, etc.   Provide a can-do attitude with high willingness to learn and the ability to work in new areas quickly   Strong communication and soft skills, especially the capacity for teamwork and customer focus as well as for target-oriented realization under pressure   Business-fluent German and English skills (both verbally and in writing)   General willingness to travel (mainly Germany, Switzerland)   Our offering & work environment We offer an appealing working environment within a motivated team to further develop your skills and personality. Moreover, with state-of-the-art collaboration technologies, we not only facilitate flexible and location-independent, but also home-office working arrangements in order to reconcile career and family life. As a matter of course, we provide you with state of the art working environment. An attractive salary model and a company car complete our offering. Flat hierarchies and extremely supportive colleagues contribute to the freedom you need to shape your personal future and the professional one within proaxia. Individually aligned development paths and training offerings as well as intense knowledge sharing are part of proaxia’s inspiring culture. We like to share our achievements within the team. Please find more information about proaxia on our websitewww.proaxia-consulting.com and in social networks.       Display original ad

Job title: ABB Ability and Digital Senior Software Developer and Architect 80%-100%
Content: ABB Ability and Digital Senior Software Developer and Architect 80%-100%   Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.  ABB AbilityTM is our unified, cross-industry digital capability — extending from device to edge to cloud — with devices, systems, solutions, services and a platform that enable our customers to know more, do more, do better, together. Our configurable systems provide a flexible approach to collecting, organizing and distributing process information throughout a processing plant from shop floor up to the Cloud. Using service oriented architecture (SOA), our systems cover fast data acquisition and network communication, historical database with plant specific structure as well as dashboards and trends through a web-based user interface.We are currently in search of an experienced Senior Software Developer to further develop and maintain our software systems. Are you innovative, dynamic, motivated, can work independently and keen on developing critical products for our clients and offering them excellent technical support? Let’s write the future, together. Your responsibilities  Along with the team, maintain, design and further develop core components for our configurable, cloud-based Predictive Maintenance Platform Co-own our system architecture by keeping a minimal set of documents up to date Analyze and improve efficiency, quality and scalability of our platform Along with product management, sales and engineering teams, analyze customer requirements, generate specifications, provide implementations and deliver working solutions Responsible for analysis and solution of system issues: Level 3 and Level 4 support  Your background  Bachelor or Master Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent skill level Minimum 5+ years of experience in professional software development (preferably within the process industry) with proven skills in C++ or C# Extensive experience with web-technologies; HTML5, SOAP, REST, Web Services Experience building, delivering and managing in a cloud environment (ideally Microsoft Azure) Proven experience in product design, architecture and development Experience working in an Agile/Devops environment with CI/CD tools is preferred Excellent coding and problem solving skills with attention to details Fluent in English written and spoken, other languages are an added advantage   Display original ad

Technical Solutions Architect Cybersecurity - Switzerland (1277474)     Why you'll love Cisco    We change the World, you will become passionate about your employer and the brand you represent. Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more meaningful than ever before in our lives. Our employees' groundbreaking ideas impact everything imaginable, from entertainment, healthcare, and education, to public and private sectors, smart-cities, and everyday devices in our homes. Here, that means we will take creative ideas from the drawing board to dynamic solutions that have real world impact. Cisco is evolving a rich solution portfolio of next generation software, hardware, and services to meet customers' changing business requirements in the digital economy.    What You'll Do    The Consulting System Engineer (CSE’s) primary responsibility is to provide technical mentorship and sales support on the Cisco Security Solution Portfolio.    You should have expertise around Network Security (including NGFW/NGIPS), Network Visibility and Enforcement (Stealthwatch or similar, Identity Services Engine and Anyconnect VPN) Cloud security (Email, Web, Anti-Spam, Cloudlock, Umbrella, WSA/CWS )   You should also have experience in Advanced Threat Solutions such as Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) and AMP for Endpoints as well as a strong background in the security domain generally.   You should be able to explain how technical solutions can be applied to solve business problems, and are able to speak the languages of business and technical decision makers alike.     Key Responsibilities     Business Development       Support the activities of the GSSO and general Sales team through direct support of identified customer opportunities, Partner identification and development.   Promote the technical value and benefits of Cisco Security solutions.   Encourage partners to utilise Cisco technology.   Build trusted technical advisor relationships with Customers and leaders of various partner groups, linking the Cisco vision to relevant business strategies. Present and demonstrate technical solutions in a business meaningful way to all levels of the customer and Partner organisation.   Use Cisco defined processes and tools such as SFDC to navigate through the sales cycle, implementing relevant Cisco enablement programs and tools to drive Security sales opportunities.     Solution and Architectural Selling     You'll explain the elements and dynamics of the Cisco Security solutions and architecture and how they're interconnected with all parts of our portfolio, ensuring that the features and benefits of Cisco technology are understood and valued by Customers.   Help partner technical sales teams design and build creative architectural solutions that drive strategic objectives and help differentiate partner offerings.   You ensure the detailed features, functionality and architectural impact of our technology in your designs and proposals are understood, valued and communicated.   Build a working knowledge of technology shifts that impact security and other architectures. For example the role of Software Defined Networking and Data Centre Architectures.     Who you’ll work with    Cisco Security delivers intelligent cybersecurity for the real world, providing one of the industry's most comprehensive advanced threat protection portfolio that is integrated, pervasive, continuous and open. Cisco's threat-centric approach to security reduces complexity while providing unmatched transparency, continuous control and advanced threat protection across the entire attack continuum -- before, during and after an attack   Global Security Sales Organization (GSSO) is taking big steps to position Cisco as the #1 IT Security provider in the industry. In addition to having the right market conditions, capabilities, products and services, we need the right people to take us there.    Who you are     University degree in a technical discipline or equivalent   You have at least 10 years of experience in the security field   You possess at least 4 years of pre-sales SE experience   Some form of in depth experience such as enterprise architecture, security operations or compliance auditing   Cisco CCIE very highly regarded   Fluent German     Personal and Organisational Development     You maintain personal organisation and time management   You are attentive to details and always follow-up   Bring and further build your outstanding presentation skills   You enjoy working flexibly to achieve your goals using the various internal and external resources available   Technical Acumen and Foundation Knowledge   Invest time and strive to learn about technology shifts, and communicate the relevant aspects to customers and partners   You are passionate about and have a true love for technology and enjoy keeping up to date with your Cisco product knowledge   Knowledge of Cisco Internetworking equipment would be helpful     Why Cisco    At Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.   Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.   We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.   We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.   We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.   Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us. #WeAreCisco   We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.      Display original ad

Portfolio Manager Smart Workplace Solutions 80-100%  We make real what matters   Siemens Smart Infrastructure connects buildings and cities to make them smarter and more energy efficient. We help our customers to thrive, communities to progress and support sustainable development to protect our planet for the next generation. Working with our global customers and partners, we help to create intelligent solutions and perfect places in the full range of buildings where we live, work and relax. Siemens Smart Infrastructure has its global headquarters in Switzerland. Region Europe, with around 7’400 colleagues, is responsible for the solution and service business and is market leader in Europe. Our Digital Building team located in Zurich guides digitalized solutions for creating smart workplaces within the assigned countries of our Region. Based on our digital product “Comfy” we are elaborating strategies to expand our position in the European market. For this purpose and to foster our team, we are looking for a dynamic colleague who will support us in implementing solutions for smart workplaces which create customer value. As our “Comfy Portfolio Manager for Smart Workplace Solutions” you will be the guardian of the value proposition and be an enabler to increase our competencies in Smart Workplace Management. An engaged and multinational team will be happy to introduce you in our environment. Join our team and help us creating environments that care!  Your new responsibilities  Regional Portfolio Manager  Identify market demands for our Comfy Smart Workplace Solutions Define solution packages and influence requirements of Comfy roadmap in order to leverage our market position within Region Europe Align the defined solutions with our peers in the countries in order to ensure market proximity Organize roll-out in the assigned countries of the pre-defined solution packages Ensure availability of documentations, trainings, and demo to enable business development and technical counterparts in countries Participate to events and exhibitions to promote Siemens’ competencies in the real estate market Ensure order-to-cash and delivery process with support of internal partners, such as business administration and our decentralized service centers in the countries Promote our Comfy solutions to a community of technical experts and product managers  Solution Architect for strategic accounts  Act as prime interface for our solution architecture towards our Headquarters Advise and define best App deployment and IoT solutions to answer customer use case in collaboration with business development colleagues Be technical advisor for our customers and attend customer meetings Ensure coverage technical scope of RFQ and RFI in due time by leveraging self of trained resources Train our colleagues in the countries to ensure the right level of know-how of our solution architects in the countries   Your skills and experience   Bachelor’s degree in a technical or business field or similar education. A combination of both would be a plus At least 3 years of experience in a similar portfolio management role, preferable for digital solution sales Solid IT foundations, like experience with IT integration, understanding of API, IT/OT protocols as well as web applications development   Any experience of our building industry would be a strong asset Ability to build trust with internal and external stakeholders, within an intercultural environment Analytical skills and the ability to see and articulate the big picture Proactive and positive attitude, willing to grow and able to deal with stress effectively Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to communicate complex topics to customers, non-experts and senior management Good presentation and communication skills in English. German and an additional European language would be a plus       Who and where we are   Find out why Siemens is chosen every year as one of the most popular employers in Switzerland, and get a first impression of a new working environment and the people who could be your new work colleagues.   Video Siemens in Zurich   Homepage Siemens as an employer     Your application   Siemens takes your privacy very seriously and ensures a high standard of data protection. As such, we can only accept your application via our application platform. Please be aware that applications sent by e-mail will not be answered and will simply be deleted. Should you have any questions about this job offer, please contact hr-recruiting.ch@siemens.com mentioning the job ID in your e-mail. We look forward to receiving your full application.   Information for recruitment agencies: Siemens does not accept recruitment agency applications for this position. Thank you for your understanding.  Job ID: 187687  Organization: Smart Infrastructure  Company: Siemens Schweiz AG, Smart Infrastructure, Global Headquarters  Experience Level: Experienced Professional  Job Type: EitherDisplay original ad

SENIOR .NET SOFTWARE ENGINEER / ARCHITECT (f/m/d)    About Atos  Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with over 110,000 employees in 73 countries and annual revenue of over € 11 billion. European number one in Cloud, Cybersecurity and High-Performance Computing, the Group provides end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications and Digital Workplace solutions. The group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and operates under the brands Atos, Atos Syntel, and Unify. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea), listed on the CAC40 Paris stock index. The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information technology space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education as well as multicultural and pluralistic approaches to research that contribute to scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the group enables its customers, employees and collaborators, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably and confidently in the information technology space. Werden Sie Digital Leader!   Atos ist ein weltweiter Marktführer in Digitaler Transformation. Unsere Mission: Menschen, Technologie und Business zu vereinen, um den Fortschritt unserer Kunden zu beschleunigen.   Für unser Entwicklungsteam im Bereich Mission Critical suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt am Standort Zürich einen motivierten Teamplayer in der Rolle als  Senior .NET Software Engineer /Architect (w/m/d)80%-100% Pensum    Ihre Aufgaben: ▶ Zu Ihrern verantwortungsvollen Aufgaben zählen das Erstellen von kundenspezifischen und komplexen Software Lösungen mit nationaler Bedeutung für unsere Kunden und die Schweizer Bevölkerung▶ In einem agilen Team mit umfangreichem Experten-wissen setzen Sie anspruchsvolle Entwicklungsprojekte inhouse am Standort Zürich um▶ Enge Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Product Ownern, Software Architekten und Software Engineers▶ Aufbau und Pflege der Vertrauensbeziehungen mit unseren Kunden in mittel- bis langfristigen Projekten▶ Mitarbeit im Presales und in der Business Analyse▶ Einsätze beim Kunden vor Ort für Workshops & Releases   Ihr Profil: ▶ Sie verfügen über einen erfolgreichen Hochschulabschluss (FH, Uni, ETH, HF) in Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Aus- und Weiterbildung▶ Mindestesn 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Software Engineer mit .NET Technologien▶ Gute Kenntnisse im Requirements Engineering und in der Software Architektur▶ Fundierte Kenntnisse bei der Realisierung von Applikationen WPF, Schnittstellen mit WFC oder Backendkomponenten▶ Erfahrungen mit Web-Technologien (Angular, HTML5, Javascript, CSS) von Vorteil▶ Exzellentes Knowhow hinsichtlich professionellen Softwareentwicklungsprozessen▶ Analytische und strukturierte Arbeitsweise mit ausgeprägter Kundenorientierung und hohem Qualitätsbewusstsein▶ Da die Projekte im sensitiven Umfeld angesiedelt sind, erfüllen Sie die Bedingungen zum Bestehen der Personensicherheitsprüfung, wie z. B. Schweizer Staatsbürgerschaft oder Niederlassungsbewilligung C▶ Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse auf muttersprachlichem Niveau und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift  Ihre Bewerbung  Nutzen Sie diese Chance und bwereben Sie sich auf diese spannende und vielseitige Funktion über unsere Karriereseite. Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir nur vollständige Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Anschreiben, Lebenslauf) berücksichtigen können. Wir freuen uns auf Sie!   Wir haben uns zum Ziel gesetzt, Diversität in unserem Unternehmen zu fördern. Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung, unabhängig von Geschlecht, Herkunft, Alter, Behinderung oder sexueller Orientierung.   Display original ad

Job title: GLOBAL THERAPEUTIC AREA HEAD (MEDICAL) WITHIN ONCOLOGY/ HEMATOLOGY Global Product Development - Medical Affairs (PDMA)
Content: GLOBAL THERAPEUTIC AREA HEAD (MEDICAL) WITHIN ONCOLOGY/ HEMATOLOGY Global Product Development - Medical Affairs (PDMA) The global Medical working model for Oncology / Hematology comprises three dedicated Therapeutic Areas (TAs) – based on the three pillars of the global oncology / hematology strategy:lung cancer, breast cancer and hematology. Other tumor types / indications and overarching frameworks (e.g. PHC, ImCORE) will be assigned to or across respective TAs based on optimal patient benefit / customer value    GENERAL ROLE CONTEXT  You will provide agile leadership, guidance, direction and framing as a visionary Architect, Coach and Catalyst. You will lead and empower teams and employees to achieve their objectives in a culture of curiosity, accountability, innovation and co creation. You will act as a key integrator, approaching work from an outcome rather than a functional perspective. You will display strong transformational and mobilizing leadership skills to inspire people to do their best work, constructively challenge the status quo and be committed to our cultural evolution.And you will relentlessly focus on meaningful outcome for patients and societies, putting the patient first in everything you do.   As a Medical TA Head you will provide leadership, strategic guidance and holistic support to the personnel and medical teams within the respective therapeutic area. You will closely align and collaborate with other TA Heads in Global Product Strategy (GPS) and Clinical Development, Life Cycle Leaders and other stakeholders in a matrix organization, enabling the meaningful integration and delivery of the Medical strategy into the lifecycle and integrated strategy plans of your TA. You will provide strong clinical, scientific and healthcare ecosystem experience for key cross functional stakeholders. You will act as a key ambassador, connector and credible partner for the broad range of external medical partners, customers and stakeholders. The roles report into the Head PD Medical Affairs.  SPECIFIC ROLE CONTEXT   As a TA Head (Medical) you will    Lead the creation and implementation of the long-term Medical vision and key objectives for the TA within the respective integrated Lifecycle strategies Drive optimal resource use and outcome focused investment within and across therapeutic area medical teams, displaying an enterprise / LSPC (Late Stage Portfolio Committee) mindset Be accountable for the development and successful delivery of the Medical contributions towards the lifecycle and integrated strategy plans, including   Situation analysis on TA level with a patient centric focus on Medical advancements and general healthcare ecosystem evolution The holistic provision of an integrated evidence generation plan and oversight for the wider enterprise Definition, prioritization and constant evolution of Medical objectives and Medical Value narrative on TA level Identification and innovation of the respective tactical Medical activity portfolio   Contribute to establishing and implementing appropriate policies and standards for all activities of the integrated medical contribution (e.g. studies, publications, registries, TAE collaborations) Ensure that planning and implementation of medical contribution are aligned with global processes and standards       What will set you up for success   You are a Medical Doctor with substantial clinical and scientific experience in the relevant therapeutic area, fully familiar with current clinical practice in the major global healthcare and regulatory systems and deeply engaged into the anticipation of the future evolution of Medicine You bring significant leadership and business experience in the pharmaceutical or biotech industry, in a Development, Medical or strategic function at a country and a global or regional level You have a proven track record of scientific/medical cooperation and network with key global therapeutic area experts and respective societies/collaborative groups You have operated accountably and successfully in the space of next level data generation with a specific appreciation of clinical practice data, real world data and HTA enabling data   You have a strong track record of collaboration/ partnership with cross functional networks and teams, specifically Access, Development and Commercial, on country and global level You are experienced and skilled with accountability for substantial budgets, embracing a mindset of meaningful enterprise investment versus a mindset of functional spend You are an inspiring and visionary leader, living up to highest ethical standards, Roche Values, Leadership Commitments and Core Competencies You excel in a matrix environment, are comfortable with complexity and ambiguity, and strive working across multiple cultures and countries with a focus on prioritization and outcome You relentlessly simplify and accelerate work at any step towards greater value for patients and societies   You embrace curiosity, experimentation, learning and collaboration as essential elements of the work You are inspired by and comfortably using the offerings of digital technology in the space of communication, analytics and services You take pride in constantly identifying and recruiting external talent, growing yourself and people around you towards purposeful contribution     What your key outputs will be   Your key accountability is to enable the Medical teams to develop and deliver effective and meaningful, strategically aligned Medical contributions to the relevant Life Cycle Teams (LCTs)/ ISQUADs You are accountable for development and delivery of the Medical strategies / contributions to the overall TA / Disease Area strategic plans You ensure the availability and timely provision of holistic external Medical intelligence / insights within your TA for all key internal audiences You compellingly and credibly communicate TA Medical content to in- and external audiences across the full range of communication channels and platforms You act as external spokesperson on behalf of the enterprise within your TA and beyond as required You represent the enterprise in respective external Medical / Academic communities for your TA and beyond where appropriate You enable appropriate resource planning, ensuring that contributions take place as planned and with appropriate investment management towards optimal value for patients and societies You drive the scouting and recruitment of in- and external talent and are accountable for people development, management as well as all other line manager responsibilities You enable and implement new ways of working / agile methodology as seen fit for purpose You engage actively in the constant evolution of the Global Medical function as well as the enterprise     Major technical role aspects / requirements  This is a global role based in Basel or San Francisco. A location at other Roche sites (Mississauga, Shanghai, Welwyn) can be considered. Intensive global travel is required. The role is in full adherence and actively advocates / contributes to internal policies, guidelines, and SOPs, as well as recognized GCP and ethical standards. Adherence to required training modules and responsibility for full training compliance of employees is expected.   The TA Head is contributing to the PDMA Leadership team, the Medical Affairs Council, Franchise Leadership Teams and other communities as seen purposeful and value adding. They chair the Medical Affairs Review Committee for the respective therapeutic area (unless delegated) They represent PDMA at the Development Review Committee and the Business Review Committee (unless delegated)      When submitting your application please indicate the respective Therapeutic Area(Lung Cancer, Breast Cancer, Hematology)      Display original ad

Head RM Business Architecture            Location: Zurich, ZH, CH             Head RM Business Architecture    About Swiss Re  The Swiss Re Group is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. It anticipates and manages risk – from natural catastrophes to climate change, from ageing populations to cybercrime. The aim of the Swiss Re Group is to enable society to thrive and progress, creating new opportunities and solutions for its clients. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, where it was founded in 1863, the Swiss Re Group operates through a network of around 80 offices globally. It is organised into three Business Units, each with a distinct strategy and set of objectives contributing to the Group’s overall mission.     About RM    Our Risk Management function helps ensure Swiss Re's profitability and sustainable growth over time. This ensures that Swiss Re can honour its promises. Risk Management makes Swiss Re itself more resilient: We help the business to steer away from risks that could destabilise us and identify risks worth taking. We create risk transparency, leveraging our knowledge and experience, and bringing an independent, global and long-term perspective.     About the role - Head RM Business Architecture    We are looking for an experienced enterprise architect to join our Risk Management Operations team. This is a great opportunity for you to build up a small team of business architects who will develop and maintain the business architecture for Risk Management. In this hands-on role, you will be a reliable partner for our leadership team. You will support them in taking on new challenges and build a future-ready architecture. Your key responsibilities will include:  Build up and lead a small team of business and data architects Analyze key business and risk developments and translate them into reference architectures and roadmap for Risk Management Develop architectural guardrails and ensure their implementation Own creation and maintenance of our business and data architecture to support Risk Managements ambitions and processes Establish a lean but operational governance over our business architecture Assess new technologies and work with our IT architecture team to recommend their future adoption Guide projects and challenge today's solutions to ensure interoperability and align end-toend across Risk Management Collaborating with IT to assist in promoting architectural innovation driven both by IT and RM Have an end-to-end overview of Risk Management business and data architecture and act as spokesperson for Risk Management for key initiatives Partner with functions beyond Risk Management to promote architectural innovation driven by RM and IT and connect to key initiatives that transform Swiss Re's architecture     About you     You are a team player and like working with complementary teams across multiple areas and locations You convince on all levels of the organization, successfully interacting with stakeholders from experts to senior executives You are excited by technologies trends You have at least 5 years' experience as an architect, preferable in a global environment, working on complex enterprise architecture programs You are an expert in developing data models for business and technical audiences, and you are familiar with data management disciplines like MDM and data warehousing You have working knowledge of micro-service architectures, cloud environments and advanced analytics You passionately turn strategy into action and you deliver tangible results You are experienced leading in architectural alignment across functions using suitable governance instruments like steering boards University degree or equivalent and professional experience in computer science, software engineering or similar     We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.    Keywords:   Reference Code: 85679           Display original ad

Job title: Solution Architekt Business Intelligence & Analytics 80% - 100% (IT Backend Development & Support)
Content: Solution Architekt Business Intelligence & Analytics 80% - 100% (IT Backend Development & Support)    www.zkb.ch/jobs   Willkommen als Solution Architekt Business Intelligence & Analytics  Arbeitspensum 80% - 100% / Arbeitsort Zürich, Neue Hard 9    Unser Team entwickelt, integriert und betreibt Applikationen im Umfeld Business Intelligence & Analytics. Für den erfolgreichen Design und Aufbau eines Data Warehouses suchen wir einen Solution Architekten, welcher in einem dynamischen Umfeld die agilen Werte lebt, die Übersicht behält, die Chancen eines crossfunktionalen Teams erkennt und diese mit innovativen Lösungen nutzt.  Die Herausforderung    Entwicklung einer adäquaten DWH/BI&A-Architektur   Verantwortung für die Konzeption und das Design von DWH/BI-Komponenten   Erstellung von Lösungskonzepten für DWH/BI-Applikationen in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Fachbereich, den Kollegen im BI&A-Team und dem SW-Lieferanten   Erstellung und Einhaltung von Standards und Guidelines im Bereich BI&A   Fachliches Coaching eines Entwickler-/ Integrationsteams und konsequentes (Vor-)Leben der agilen Werte  Mitwirkung bei der Ausgestaltung bzw. Verordnung der (Daten-)Modelle in den unterschiedlichen BI&A-Layer (Rohdaten, DWH, Data Virtualization, Reporting-/Analyse-Tools) Mitwirkung und Mitgestaltung beim Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung, Automatisierung der BI&A-Layer Aufbau Data Catalogue (Type, Ownership, Bezeichnung, Sensitivity etc) – Stichwort Meta Data Driven Modelling/Development. Entwickeln und gestalten von konzeptionellen und logischen Datenmodellen     Ihr Profil    Sie bringen eine fundierte technische Wirtschaftsinformatik- oder Informatikausbildung mit (Level Bachelor oder Master)   Mindestens 10 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich BI&A als Solution Architekt   Fundierte Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von DataMarts, Cubes, Column oder Rowstores   Profi im Bereich der Datenmodellierung d.h. kennen und anwenden der konzeptionellen und logischen Datenmodellierung (3NF, Data Vault, Snow-/Star-Flake) und Erfahrungen mit virtuellen und persistenten Datenlayer   Knowhow und Praxiserfahrung im Bereich Meta oder Model Driven Development und Automation   Technologie-Stack: Oracle Exadata und hohe Affinität zu ETL-Tools (z.B. Informatica PowerCenter, PowerDesigner), Denodo, Tableau und Enterprise Architect   Starkes Bankfachliches Knowhow   Mehrjährige Erfahrung mit Methoden in der agilen Softwareentwicklung   Inhaltliche Brücken zwischen verschiedenen Stakeholdern (Fach, Architektur, DevOps-Team etc.) bilden  Sie können sich neues Wissen schnell aneignen und behalten stets den Gesamtüberblick bei komplexen Lösungen. Sie sind initiativ, ergebnisorientiert, verantwortungsbewusst, belastbar und arbeiten gerne mit Menschen. Da unsere Geschäftssprache Deutsch ist, setzen wir sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse voraus.  Ihr Kontakt Haben wir Sie "gluschtig" gemacht? Dann zögern Sie nicht und nehmen Sie Kontakt mit uns auf. Wir freuen uns auf das gegenseitige Kennenlernen. Falls Sie Fragen haben, so steht Ihnen Andrea Wechsler telefonisch selbstverständlich zur Verfügung. Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir für diese Stelle ausschliesslich Direktbewerbungen berücksichtigen.Andrea WechslerTalentgewinnung & RekrutierungTelefon: 044 292 80 88 Helfen Sie uns, Ihre Daten zu schützen und senden Sie uns Ihre Bewerbung ausschliesslich online über unser Bewerbungsmanagement-Tool. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung. Jetzt online bewerben   Seite drucken Display original ad

Cloud Platform Solution Engineer  Cloud Platform Solution Engineer   Preferred Qualifications   Cloud Platform Architect  At Oracle, we are continuously striving to me the most innovative and customer focused company in the world. Oracle have been helping customers since more than 30 years to deliver business value from Information Technologies and Business Applications. As a Cloud Platform Architect within the fast growing Oracle Cloud Platform, you will have the opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Oracle IAAS and PAAS within our Top Account in ALPS Cluster (CH AT)  Your Role:    Support our clients,across all industry sectors, in exploiting Oracle's leading-edgetechnology portfolio – in the Cloud and on Premises   Support the sales process leading engagement at all levels within both Oracle and the customer organizations.   Partner and guide the sales team to design Sales strategies and solutions for customers, drive Oracle adoption and revenue.   Design and participate in technology pilot projects or proof of concept (POC) activities   Define values propositions, positioning and differentiation to competitor’s products   Lead request for information (RFI) and request for proposal (RFP)   Drive sales opportunities to successful completion   Be an Oracle evangelist. Educate customers of all sizes on the value proposition of Oracle Cloud Platform   Establishcredibility & build deep relationships with senior technical andbusiness individuals within customers to enable them to be cloudadvocates.   Participate in deep architectural / Functionaldiscussions to build confidence and ensure customer success whenbuilding new and migrating existing applications, software and serviceson the Oracle Cloud Platform   Conduct deep-dive “hands-on” education/training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers   Author or contribute to customer-facing publications such as whitepapers, tutorials, etc.   Present sessions at Community and industry conferences.   Work alongside partners and other third party organizations as required   Define and drive pre-sales initiatives in target accounts and territories   Own each engagement, and help ensure a timely and successful delivery of value.   Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the Oracle community.   Understand Oracle market segments, customer base, and industry verticals.   The ideal candidate will possess customer-facing skills that will allow them to represent Oracle well within a customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel within the company, as well as a technical/functional background that enables them to easily interact and give guidance with software developers and architects. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think structured about business, product, and technical challenges. You must be interested in advancing your knowledge, be self-motivated, proactive, and we will provide you with continuing education possibilities around technical and personal development skills. Oracle provides a ramp-up program that includes self-paced learning, instructor-led training, hands-on projects, job shadowing opportunities, and a peer-reviewed opportunity to demonstrate your knowledge.  QUALIFICATIONS:    Strong experience on Cloud Platform : Infrastructure and Platform as a Service   Design of Data Center-level computing architectures, Cloud, or Hybrid solutions preferred   Data Center to Cloud Transformation Experience   Software Architecture, Containers, Cloud Native and Devops   Data Management Platform : Database, Datawarehouse, DataLake, Big Data,   Understanding of Business Applications deployments   Experience in identity management and security architectures   Technical design authority role for large projects   Experience with Oracle Technologies in these domains is an advantage   Technical degree required; Computer Science or Math background highly desired   Excellent communication skills with an ability to right level conversations   Excellent Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers   Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly   Ability to travel   Fluency in English is essential. German is a strong advantage, French a plus.   To apply please e-mail your CV to Alexandra Matei I Oracle Talent Advisory Organization I alexandra.matei@oracle.com I 40 735 610 266. Oracle Recruiting: "Continuously selected by our clients as the exclusive vendor of preeminent talent".  Aspart of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required tocomplete a pre-employment screening process, prior to an offer beingmade. This will involve identity and employment verification, salaryverification, professional references, education verification andprofessional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).   Detailed Description and Job Requirements  Provides direction and specialist knowledge in applying the technology/application to client business. Facilitation of customer product/application understanding through presentations demonstrations and benchmarks; provision of support throughout the sell. As a Principal Sales Consultant you will be responsible as the expert for formulating and leading presales technical / functional support activity to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction. Acts as a technical resource and mentor for less experienced Sales Consultants. Focuses on large or complex sales opportunities that need creative and complex solutions. Develops productivity tools and training for other Sales Consultants. Develops and delivers outstanding Oracle presentations and demonstrations. Leads any and all aspects of the technical sales process. Advises internal and external clients on overall architect solutions. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 3 years vendor (sales and marketing) experience. 7 years business experience with relevant computer applications or database/tools. Ability to implement the most advanced product features. Thorough knowledge of system and application design. In depth knowledge of competitors. Demonstrated project management skills. Demonstrated excellent verbal and written communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business justification, closing techniques. Ability to persuade others through presentations, demonstrations, and written communication. Ability to travel as needed. A/BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable.  As part of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required to successfully complete a pre-employment screening process. This will involve identity and employment verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).   Job: Pre Sales  Location: CH-CH,Switzerland-Baden-Daettwil  Job Type: Regular Employee Hire  Organization: Oracle Display original ad

ICT Application Engineer 80% bis 100%    Was du bewegstAufgrund von fachlichen und kundenspezifischen Anforderungen planst du Transport sowie Patch und Release. Dank dir laufen Applikations-Releases einwandfrei. Bei Kundenanfragen und Zwischenfällen bewahrst du einen kühlen Kopf und entwickelst versiert Lösungen. So gewährleistest du den störungsfreien Betrieb von Kundenapplikationen. Technische und fachliche Fehleranalyse sowie 1st Level Support bei Abbruch oder Fehlern meisterst du spielend. Du arbeitest in fortlaufenden Projekten mit und baust bestehende Plattformen aus. Dabei übernimmst du Koordinationsaufgaben zwischen involvierten internen und externen Stellen. Auch Upgrades von Applikationen, Middleware und Datenbanken erledigst du erfahren und mit Verantwortung. Im Monitoring optimierst du präventiv Redundanzen und sorgst so für Stabilität.  Weshalb dir das gelingt  Abschluss (FH) in Informatik oder Betriebswirtschaft oder mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in diesem Gebiet Kenntnisse in Betrieb, Integration, Cloud Computing, Container Platform und Platform as a Service Erfahrung in Unix/Linux, Shell-Scripting, bash Script's, Java und Weblogic Know-how in Container-Technologien (RedHat OpenShift/ Kubernetes/ Docker) sowie Wissen in Collaboration Tools (z.B. JIRA, Confluence, Slack) Kenntnisse in SCM Tools (z.B. Git, Github, Subversion, Oracle Datenbanken und SQL) Vertraut mit agilen Methoden Rasche Auffassung, hohe Qualitätsansprüche Gutes Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift       Neugierig auf mehr?Als ICT Application Engineer ... startest du so rasch wie möglich ... kannst teilweise im Home-Office arbeiten ... reist du nicht regelmässig   Diese Stelle möchten wir ohne externe Personaldienstleister besetzen.   KontaktJakob +41-58-221 13 34   Job Nummer6606 KonzerneinheitSwisscom (Schweiz) AG   Weitere Stellen    ICT Architect Data Center     ICT Architect     Cloud System Engineer     Senior Security Engineer  Alle offenen Stellen      Was dich erwartet   Faire Arbeitsbedingungen    Faire Arbeitsbedingungen Du profitierst von den fortschrittlichen Anstellungsbedingungen des Swisscom Gesamtarbeitsvertrages (GAV). Wir bezahlen einen fairen, marktgerechten Lohn und belohnen zusätzlich gute Leistungen. Unser Lohnsystem ist transparent.    Grosszügige Sozialleistungen    Grosszügige Sozialleistungen Swisscom bietet dir über die Pensionskasse comPlan eine gut ausgebaute Altersvorsorge mit individuell wählbaren Sparvarianten. Bei Krankheit oder Unfall gewähren wir dir eine grosszügige Lohnfortzahlung.    Arbeitswelt    Arbeitswelt Bei Swisscom wird Innovation und kontinuierliche Verbesserung aktiv gefördert und von dir mitgestaltet. Wir arbeiten in interdisziplinären Teams. Co-working, Prototyping und agile Arbeitsmethoden sind fester Bestandteil unserer Kultur.    Flexibel arbeiten    Flexibel arbeiten Mit der Möglichkeit zu Gleitzeit, Teilzeit oder Jobsharing unterstützen wir dich dabei, Arbeit und Privatleben gut unter einen Hut zu bringen. Und weil Reisen den Horizont erweitert, kannst du entweder unbezahlten Urlaub beantragen oder pro Jahr bis zu zwei Wochen zusätzliche Ferien kaufen.    Familie und Beruf    Familie und Beruf Uns ist wichtig, dass du Beruf und Familie optimal miteinander vereinbaren kannst. Wir gewähren 18 Wochen Mutterschaftsurlaub und 3 Wochen Vaterschaftsurlaub. Mit dem Programm «Childcare» unterstützen wir dich bei Fragen zur Betreuung deiner Kinder und ermöglichen dir mit «Work & Care», kranke Angehörige zu pflegen.    Fringe Benefits    Fringe Benefits Wir offerieren dir einen monatlichen grosszügigen Rabatt auf bestimmte Swisscom Produkte. Zudem profitierst du von vergünstigten Tickets und Abonnements des öffentlichen Verkehrs. Ein weiterer Vorteil: In unseren Personalrestaurants kannst du dich gesund und für wenig Geld verpflegen.
