Technical Project Manager (Propulsion Digitalisation)       Join the Power Revolution WinGD (Winterthur Gas & Diesel Ltd.) plays a vital role in powering the marine industry and shaping our environment. As a leading developer of two-stroke, low-speed gas and diesel engines, used to power merchant shipping, our people are driving solutions on a global scale. Our target is to set the industry standard for reliability, efficiency and environmental sustainability in marine propulsion. WinGD-designed engines are manufactured under license worldwide. Headquartered in Winterthur, Switzerland, since its inception in 1893, WinGD has preserved and continued the legacy of the Sulzer Diesel Engine business for excellence in design. Our success in this ever evolving, competitive environment is based on the drive, innovation and passion of our diverse employee population, over 350 people worldwide, representing over 25 different nationalities. Together we work towards providing the solutions that will continue to revolutionize our industry. WinGD is looking for a   Technical Project Manager (Propulsion Digitalisation)   Responsibilities     Technical and administrative project leadership of development of a digital modular eco-system for monitoring, diagnostic, troubleshooting support, and condition-based maintenance for marine propulsion systems; connect ships’ propulsion systems, engine rooms, and fleets of ships. Define and follow a lean roadmap, containing of small, controllable and self-contained steps; Lead all the stages of the development and adoption process from planning through execution to deployment and field feedback; Actively support efficient process for requirements collection and develop scenarios based on different boundary conditions. Employ agile development practices, focusing on proper specifications, early deliveries and validation, and continuous improvement. Drive project in Project Management role and contribute with own expertise on technical level. Develop plans, establish resource requirements, draw up budget and ensure resource allocation for successful completion; Lead the project team members allocated through close cooperation and suitable project progress meetings including group meetings and system design review meetings. Enable gathering of process data (by sensors or calculations), transmitting it for preparation and analytics, and displaying valuable information concerning the propulsion system with WinGD engines. Provide support for establishing a feedback- and feedforward channels to different 3-rd party platforms both on-board a ship, and organisational units within WinGD and service partners. Collaboration with IT infrastructure and data analytics teams. Coordination with external suppliers and development partners.     Requirements    Education:  BSc or MSc in a relevant technical field (Computer Science, Information technologies, Engineering)  Experience:  At least 5 years’ experience as an architect of Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) connected solutions. Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Technical Project Management role.  Experience in the field of process analysis appreciated. Knowledge of the shipping industry and marine applications and regulations is a plus.  Desired Skills:  Good understanding of technologies like IoT, Edge and Cloud computing, associated platforms, and cyber security requirements associated. Ability to understand and break-down business- and higher-level requirements into implementable and testable steps of a roadmap; blend business needs with digital technologies. Strong engineering sense to recognise areas for improvement, dependencies, and constraints of complex energy efficiency systems, and consequentially, continuously plan for enhancements. Business acumen to evaluate the commercial implications of adopting given technologies and platforms. Good analytical and problem-solving skills. System engineering skills. Strong project management skills. Team player, yet able to work independently. Enjoying working in multicultural environment. Good command of English (must) and German (desired). Ability to self-manage; taking ownership of projects: budgeting, work planning, resource management and reporting. A start-up personality; entrepreneurial, ambitious, independent, systematic attention to detail, structured thinker, goal-oriented, flexible and able to deal well with setbacks.     Our offer     An opportunity to shape the sustainability and environmental impact of the shipping industry. WinGD is on the leading edge of the technology which is shaping the future of the shipping industry A dynamic working environment, blending a long history of technology expertise with industry leading innovation across a global network Award winning, extraordinary products. Our engines are really big and really awesome Multi-cultural and interdisciplinary teams offering diverse perspectives and collaborative thinking Dynamic and interactive working conditions. WinGD offers a non-hierarchical, agile structure where input and ideas are welcome In-house technology training and professional development opportunities     Further information  For additional information about this position and WinGD, please visit www.wingd.com or get in contact with the Line Manager Mr. Stefan Goranov (+41 52 264 86 11 )               
 Display original ad

Job title: Specialist SAP on Azure - French/English speaker
Content: Specialist SAP on Azure - French/English speaker  Microsoft is a company where passionate innovators come to collaborate, envision what can be, and take their careers to levels they can't achieve anywhere else. This is a world of more possibilities, more innovation, more openness, and sky's-the-limit thinking -- a cloud-enabled world.   At Microsoft we have unique capabilities to meet the needs of both individuals and organizations. We care deeply about taking our ideals and vision around the globe, and to make a difference in peoples' lives and organizations in all corners of the planet.    Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet.    Are you insatiably curious? Do you embrace uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from your mistakes? Do you collaborate well with others, knowing that better solutions come from working together? Do you stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve, and are you motivated every day to empower others to achieve more through technology and innovation? Are you ready to join the team that is at the leading edge of Innovation at Microsoft?   To learn more about Microsoft’s mission, please visit: https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-cultureCheck out all our products at: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us   Responsibilities   As an Azure SAP Specialist, you will be a senior solution sales leader within our enterprise sales organization working with our most important customers. You will lead a virtual team of technical, partner and consulting resources to advance the sales process to achieve/exceed quarterly SAP solution sales and usage/consumption targets for related workloads in your assigned accounts.   You will be an Azure and Datacenter Infrastructure subject matter expert. You will build and maintain relationships with customers, influence long-term strategic direction and act as a trusted advisor driving engagement at the CXO level with technology decision makers. You will help customers evaluate their cloud strategy, determine approaches to application and data migration and modernization, and recommend solutions that meet their requirements. You will remove roadblocks to deployment and drive customer satisfaction.  Primary accountabilities for this role include   40% of your time will be spent leading business level dialogue with customers around the SAP workloads, including Business transformation for enterprise computing and digital transformation. You will engage Microsoft Account and solution teams on assessing SAP solution strategy with a broad set of customers in a geographical region, and present to customers in one-many venues on the Microsoft Solution Strategy for SAP 40% of your time will be spent on acting as a senior Sales and solution Subject Matter Expert to Sales teams, Cloud Architects and Solution Specialists and develop engagement approaches leveraging assets across Microsoft SAP Architects, Product Teams and Engineering. You will brief Microsoft Executives around complex sales opportunities, including competitive strategies and close plans and work with partners to engage customers with joint value positioning 20% of your time will be spent on influencing the Microsoft Azure SAP go-to-market strategies by providing feedback to sales, marketing, and engineering on current and future product requirements and sales blockers. You will be recognized for sharing, learning and driving work that results in business impact for customers, partners and Microsoft. We encourage thought leadership and we encourage all our employees to continuously maintain and enhance their technical, sales, professional skills and competitive readiness. You will therefore be required to attain and maintain required certifications.    Qualifications    Professional    Experience. 10+ years enterprise technology pre-sales or consulting experience with deep expertise on SAP Netweaver platform required Account Management. 10+ years effective territory/account management and leading sales teams: planning, opportunity qualification and creation, stakeholder and executive communication, needs analysis, value engineering, services/partner engagement, opportunity management and proposal response, pipeline management, large dollar licensing and deal negotiation required Executive Presence. 10+ years’ experience and expertise selling to C-Suite and executive business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the value of Azure SAP to the customer’s overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria. Required Problem Solver. Ability to solve customer problems through cloud technologies required Collaborative. Orchestrate and influence virtual teams to pursue sales opportunities and lead v-teams through influence Technical Azure Platform. Understanding of Microsoft server products and/or complementing solutions. The position requires the ability to articulate and present the business value of Microsoft's solutions and have a firm understanding of Microsoft's strategies and products relative to major Microsoft competitors preferred SAP: Ability to deliver quick POC/landscape sizing and demos using SAP Netweaver platform. 10-15 years in presales SAP ERP Systems to large Enterprise customers. Installation of SAP systems based on SAP NetWeaver for all supported database and operating system combinations. Installation, integration and configuration of SAP HANA, S/4 HANA, SAP Business Suite and SAP BW French and English mandatory Leadership. Experience leading large cloud engagements, especially those involving Infrastructure modernization and migration preferred Competitive Landscape. Knowledge of enterprise software solutions and cloud and datacenter infrastructure competitor landscape Partners. Deep Partner engagement and Management skills with SAP focused Practices. Certifications. Azure Admin Associate or Architect required Communication: Executive level speaking and presentation skills, and good written communication skills Exceptional demonstrated decision-making, conflict resolution, problem solving and negotiation skills Education Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science/Information Technology or a similar information technology-related discipline, MBA preferred, or equivalent experience SAP Hana Certification/Migration specialist certification    Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.    Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.  Display original ad

Customer Success Manager Encourage curiosity. Keep improving. Be enthusiastic. Stay humble. Celebrate successes. Always be respectful & positive. Customers’ success is our strength.   These are the values the people of SpotMe carry with them every single day, it makes us who we are. It empowers us to continue our impressive growth since our founding in 2001.   Headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland with additional offices in the Big Apple (New York), The Windy City (Chicago), Sofia, and Singapore we operate on a global scale with over 160 employees bringing our Engagement Platform to clients such as Red Hat, Pfizer, L’Oréal and PwC. Our people, together with amazing business advisors and consultants, create collectively the culture of the company that makes our team truly world-class.   We are on a mission. We are redefining how our clients engage with their audiences - whether that is engagement with customers, new talent, or their current workforce. Just as the playing field of our clients is constantly changing, at SpotMe you will deal with a dynamic environment as well. We embrace change and we’ve been recognized for it. As a testament to our growth, we were named a key growth player by G2 and Forrester.     The opportunity:  We are looking for high-energy Customer Success Managers who will serve as client advocates and enable our customers to create apps by leveraging our platform to its fullest extent. Our Customer Success Managers will drive customer onboarding, maximize adoption, and ensure swift resolution of challenges. This position reports to the VP Customer Success.    Responsibilities:   1. Drive customer success outcomes   Act as the primary point of contact to platform customers, being the trusted partner for the customer on use cases and product functionality Support customers to maximize platform usage and exceed their business objectives, including reach, engagement and automation Identify upsell opportunities and work collaboratively with Account Managers and Account Executives to promote SpotMe across the client organization; deliver success plans to customers Promote the latest product features and releases Support client renewals and adoption of new products Manage high-level queries related to performance, compliance, technical and feature requirements, quarterbacking experiences by SpotMe teams on behalf of the customer Closely monitor and drive adoption rates and support account growth; ensure license utilization targets are achieved     2. Manage customer success activities   Manage successful onboarding for assigned customers Oversee and manage technical aspects of platform implementation together with Solution Architects Provide high-level product and platform training to newly onboarded customers; develop first-class training support and material Identify and establish customer success objectives and KPIs; conduct regular data-driven business reviews to ensure customer satisfaction Act as the Voice of the Customer and provide feedback to SpotMe product management, professional services, sales and marketing teams Work hand-in-hand with the support team to streamline issue resolution and improve customer satisfaction  Track, analyze and report key client data point and indicators in various customer success systems     Requirements:   3-5 years proven experience in a SaaS environment, ideally in a Customer Success role or equivalent Track record of acting as a trusted advisor to enterprise clients Ability to understand customer needs and translate them to different audiences; communicate and influence at all levels of the organization (leadership, services, sales, marketing, product, and engineering) Courage to handle difficult discussions and patience to build consensus among multiple stakeholders Ability to process and interpret customer information such as product utilization data and customer requirements to help drive adoption Good listener while balancing SpotMe and clients’ interests Ability to work effectively under deadlines and juggle several assignments simultaneously Curiosity and desire to learn and grow Excellent professional written and oral communication in English and German is a must.   Display original ad

EMEA Healthcare Technical Leader, AWS  DESCRIPTION Would you like to accelerate healthcare innovation through the adoption of cloud computing technologies? Would you like to be part of a team focused on increasing awareness and adoption of Amazon Web Services by engaging with EMEA Healthcare organizations (Payers, Providers and Medical Research Agencies) who are reinventing their IT strategy by adopting cloud computing?Do you have the Healthcare industry experience and the technical background necessary to help further establish Amazon as a leading cloud platform provider? Joining us in a new role as EMEA Healthcare Technical Leader within Amazon Web Services (AWS) Public Sector. Focusing on the EMEA healthcare sector you will have the exciting opportunity to leverage the richness of the AWS cloud computing platform to position and drive the right technology solutions, enable the ecosystem, and address changing industry needs. Your responsibilities will include crafting and leading the healthcare technical strategy across EMEA, driving technical relationships with customers and partners to establish new business in those markets, and enabling the field team to drive the day-to-day interactions with prospects in order to build long-term business opportunity. You will guide AWS Solutions Architects to develop and promote cloud patterns and solutions for the industry, including high performance computing, storage optimization and partner based solutions. You will also work closely with the product/service teams to help them evolve the offerings and address issues, concerns, and requests from the field in order to help our clients unlock the innovation potential of healthcare data. The ideal candidate will possess a strong healthcare industry background with knowledge of healthcare delivery, systems of care, and/or research initiatives. He/she will have experience with IT solutions as applied to healthcare applications areas such as genomics, bioinformatics, electronic health systems, and patient care. He/she will also possess experience in driving engagements and interacting at the CxO level. He/she should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and delivering results is a must. Position can be based in Luxembourg or other AWS Europe hub (e.g. Paris, Munich, Madrid)     BASIC QUALIFICATIONS · The right person will be technical and analytical, and possess significant experience in developing IT solutions for the Healthcare industry.· Strong leadership skills are key, with proven verbal and written communications skills and demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.· Excellent communication and writing skills and significant experience in managing relationships with client CxO level.· Relevant technical knowledge is helpful, such as: database systems, IoT, core distributed computing concepts, fundamentals of cloud computing and virtualization, storage systems, etc. with ability to go deep enough on relevant technologies key to the industry.· Education - technical background with Computer Science, and/or Engineering/Math degree is highly desired; working knowledge of software development practices and data center / infrastructure / networking technologies highly desired.· Must have the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations and lead diverse teams.   PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS · Proven experience in developing IT solutions for Healthcare Industry with depth in one or more application areas (genomics, bioinformatics, electronic health systems, etc.)· Self-motivated with a great sense of urgency and follow-through.· Must have a good understanding of government/healthcare procurement and healthcare-specific data classification and compliance requirements.· Experience in developing and executing technical strategy across a multi-country geography· Acts in accordance with vision, mission, and established goals. Initiativbewerbung Praktikum für ca. 6 Monate WARUM SIE ZU UNS KOMMEN SOLLTENSie suchen nach einer neuen Aufgabe, bei der Sie gute Zukunftsperspektiven haben? Dann ist die Rheinmetall Group ein interessanter Arbeitgeber für Sie. Bei uns wartet mehr als ein Job auf Sie: Die Möglichkeit, mit Ihrem Können und Ihren Ideen wirklich etwas zu bewirken.  SOLUTIONS FOR A CHANGING WORLDMegatrends wie Urbanisierung, Klimawandel und die zunehmende globale Risikodichte lassen den Wunsch nach Mobilität und Sicherheit stetig wachsen. Mit unseren zukunftsweisenden Technologien im Automotive- und Defence-Bereich sichern wir die Mobilität und den Schutz moderner Gesellschaften.   Kommen Sie zu uns. Lassen Sie uns gemeinsam Lösungen entwickeln, die aus Veränderungen Chancen machen.  WOFÜR WIR SIE SUCHENWir suchen für folgende Bereiche fortlaufend potenzielle Praktikanten für ca. 6 Monate: (keine Werkstattpraktikum)    Battery Modeling an Simulation (explore the behaviour of lead-acid and/or lithium-ion batteries under different conditions & create an accurate simulation model)  Software Tesing for Embedded Systems (develop & integrate testing functionality for embedded ARM-based multicore systems)  Radar./RF-Jammer Development (develop a concept & Execute the development)  System Modelling with Matlab/Simulink (investigate new solutions to existing problems in order to design prototypes)  System Engineering: Counter-UAV Cannon (own projects)  Structural Engineer - Siemens NX / NASTRAN (help supporting the structural engineereing team, provide cassical answers to the following questions: how to resolve design problems, reduce failure & thus warranty costs..)  System Engineering - Sensor Unit Prototyping (integrate radar & electro-optical sensors mechanically & electrically into a prototype)  Model-Based System Engineering for Sensor Unit (design the system architecture for this modular sensor unit usisng Enterorise Architect / SysML)  Hit-Pattern Evaluation with Matlab (migrate our existing hit-pattern evaluation tool to Matlab 2019 & implement new features into the software for besser ease-of-use & automation)  Functional Requirements Verification with Matlab   CFD - High-Speed gas Flow Analysis   Test Device for Muzzle Velocity Measurements   Real-Time Data Logging and Analysis   Predictive Maintenance for Electronic Devices     WAS SIE MITBRINGEN SOLLTEN Bachelor- / Masterstudent ETH/FH in Informatik / Elektrotechnik / Maschinenbau / Mechatronik / Physik Erfahrung in den entsprechenden Systemen Erste Erfahrungen im gewünschten Fachgebiet Erfahrung in Phyton, C oder C ++ Sehr gute Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse Sehr gute MS-Office Anwenderkenntnisse sind von Vorteil Schnelle Auffassungsgabe Strukturiertes und eigenständiges Arbeiten Engagiert und zielstrebig belastbar und kommunikativ    Bitte geben Sie in Ihrer Bewerbung das frühestmögliche Eintrittsdatum und das gewünschte Einsatzgebiet an. Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.  WER WIR SINDDie Division Electronic Solutions der Defence Sparte des Rheinmetall Konzerns bietet als Partner der Streitkräfte und für den Bereich innere Sicherheit ein umfangreiches Portfolio an Flugabwehr-, Aufklärungs- und Feuerleitsystemen bis hin zu anspruchsvollen Simulatoren für die Ausbildung militärischer und ziviler Kunden. Das Spektrum umfasst darüber hinaus die Erstellung komplexer, technischer Publikationen.   Die börsennotierte Rheinmetall Group mit Sitz in Düsseldorf ist der substanzstarke und international erfolgreiche Technologiekonzern für Sicherheit und Mobilität. Die Automotive Sparte nimmt eine weltweite Spitzenposition als Automobilzulieferer ein und ist ein zuverlässiger Entwicklungspartner und Hersteller von Komponenten für heutige und zukünftige Antriebssysteme. Die Defence-Sparte des Konzerns ist als führendes europäisches Systemhaus für Verteidigungstechnik ein zuverlässiger Partner der Streitkräfte.   KONTAKTDETAILSAnsprechpartner: Frau Rossi Telefon: +41 44 316 32 61    TOP ARBEITGEBER     ZUM UNTERNEHMEN www.rheinmetall.com oder folgen Sie uns auf:              ANGEBOT TEILEN   mitteilen   tweet   mail      Display original ad

Backend Cloud DeveloperREF 191104.1 Backend Cloud Developer  General Start: ASAPDuration: 12 months +Amount: 100%Place: Zug area Tasks   Reinforce top development team There is a lack of capacity and competence in Backend AWS related developers Analyze requirements both functional and non functional Create AWS based cloud software Assess/Review code of team Recommend other service if more suitable Identify Risk, recommend mitigation strategy Discuss topics of interest with lead designer/architects   Skills   An academic degree in Information Science or a related field hands-on person with experience of cloud native software development tools like AWS, MSAzure, Docker, Microservices, Git – ideally a fullstack development experience 3,4 years working experience in area of cloud software development Knowledge of a programming language Java, C# optional JavaScript, Go-lang Excellent understanding and years of professional experience in software development using C#,experience with .NET Core Framework is a plus If JAVA then a comparable experience on e.g. springboot, lambda Knowledge of PaaS systems like OpenShift or Kubernetes Knowledge of OAuth2, APIs and protocols such as WebSockets or MQTT Knowledge of multi-tier architectures, with contributions to API design, data modeling andpersistent storage layer (RDBMS / NoSQL), experience with AWS Aurora DynamoDB is a plus Experience building distributed, scalable, fault-tolerant software systems that have beensuccessfully delivered to customers Experience with modern software development concepts like Agile, DevOps, Feature Teams Proficiency in designing, developing and deploying cloud based solutions leveraging As-A-Service offerings, preferably from AWS, and Docker Understanding of core AWS services, uses, and basic architecture best practices Selecting appropriate AWS services to design & deploy an application based on givenrequirements AWS Fargate (server less technology) would be benefitial. Good social skills when it comes to work in global teams or present ideas and concepts to otherstakeholders   Contact Are you interested in this job opening? Then please us send your CV in English and range of salarythrough our website. For questions, please call us at +41 41 322 10 30. We are looking forward to hearing from you! Your INTEGRATE Team INTEGRATE Informatik AG Tel. +41 41 322 10 30 Version 1.0Platz 10 Fax +41 41 322 10 35 Datum 11.2019CH-6039 Root D4 Mail contracting@integrate.ch Autor BojanaPopovicDisplay original ad

Job title: Junior Software Developer in PwC Digital Services
Content: Junior Software Developer in PwC Digital Services  Your tasks  You act as a Consultant in the field of developing and implementing technologies that solve real-world business issues. The types of technologies may include Robotic Process Automation (RPA), system interfaces, simple web-applications, business data ETL processes, and integration with AI services. You will support our customers in the design, development and implementation of those technologies. You will analyze and identify the current systems/processes of our customers and carry out assessments regarding the feasibility of technology integrations. You will work with process experts, architects and software providers on the optimal technical integration and implementation of the customer's vision of realizing technologies such as RPA.    Your profile  You have a degree as computer scientist / application developer or a comparable education. You have experience (including academic experience) in software development with common programming languages / platforms, such as: .NET, HTML, Java, JavaScript etc You are familiar and able to apply programing best practices such as handle exceptions, clean code, object oriented programming and API You are strong in communication, flexible, team-oriented and have a confident appearance. You are fluent in German and English and willing to travel within Switzerland and occasionally internationally. Ideally but not a must, you already have experience in implementing Robotics software (e.g. BluePrism, UI Path, Automation Anywhere or others). Ideally but not a must, you have experience in process design and optimization and in implementing IT projects in larger companies.    Who we are – PwC as an employer  At PwC, we create value for both our people and clients in Assurance, Tax & Legal, Consulting, Deals and Digital Services. And you can do the same. Want to make an impact and shape the future of a leading professional services firm? Are you passionate and ready to embrace change? Then you've got what it takes to reimagine the possible. Everyone's career path is unique. That's why PwC offers countless personal and professional development opportunities that fit with your aspirations, supporting you to grow your own way – so you can become everything you want to be and more. More about Digital Services Display original ad

Senior Security Engineer 80% bis 100%    Was du bewegstIn unserem Industriezweig mit sehr hohen Security-Erwartungen begleitest du zusammen mit dem DevOps Team die Einführung des elektronischen Patientendossiers. Dabei verantwortest du Informationssicherheitsaspekte und End-to-End-Security-Architekturen. Du planst IT-Security-Analysen, führst Workshops durch und bist an Assessments und Audits beteiligt. In Security-Governance-Gremien mit unseren Teams achtest du darauf, Security-Aspekte einzuhalten und weiterzuentwickeln. Zudem treibst du den Erfahrungsaustausch voran. Dazu gestaltest du Security-Strategien und -Konzepte im Solution Business aktiv mit und leistest einen wesentlichen Beitrag, um Portfolios der Security Services zu entwickeln.  Weshalb dir das gelingt  Abschluss (ETH/Uni/FH) in Informatik oder in einer verwandten Fachrichtung oder gleichwertiges Praxiswissen Sehr gute Kenntnisse in IT-Sicherheitsarchitekturen, Risikomanagement, Standards und Konzepten Know-how in aktuellen Trends (OWASP Top 10) und Taktiken bei Cyberangriffen Erfahrung in Linux Kenntnisse in Cloud- und Container-Technologien (inkl. Security Aspekte) von Vorteil Zertifizierungen wie MAS Information Security, CISSP, CISM, CISA, CEH oder GIAC von Vorteil Sehr gutes Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift       Neugierig auf mehr?Als Senior Security Engineer ... startest du so rasch wie möglich ... kannst du teilweise im Home-Office arbeiten ... reist du bis zu 20% deiner Arbeitszeit       KontaktMagdalena +41-58-223 73 78   Job Nummer5057 KonzerneinheitSwisscom Health   Weitere Stellen    ICT Application Engineer     ICT Architect Data Center     ICT Architect     Cloud System Engineer  Alle offenen Stellen      Was dich erwartet   Faire Arbeitsbedingungen    Faire Arbeitsbedingungen Du profitierst von den fortschrittlichen Anstellungsbedingungen des Swisscom Gesamtarbeitsvertrages (GAV). CTO CorSo Digital Ecosystems            Location: Zurich, ZH, CH             CTO CorSo Digital Ecosystems    About Swiss Re  The Swiss Re Group is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. It anticipates and manages risk – from natural catastrophes to climate change, from ageing populations to cybercrime. The aim of the Swiss Re Group is to enable society to thrive and progress, creating new opportunities and solutions for its clients. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, where it was founded in 1863, the Swiss Re Group operates through a network of around 80 offices globally. It is organised into three Business Units, each with a distinct strategy and set of objectives contributing to the Group’s overall mission.     About Swiss Re  Swiss Re Corporate Solutions provides risk transfer solutions to large and mid-sized corporations around the world. Its innovative, highly customised products and standard insurance covers help to make businesses more resilient, while its industry-leading claims service provides additional peace of mind. Swiss Re Corporate Solutions serves clients from over 50 offices worldwide and is backed by the financial strength of the Swiss Re Group. Do you want to become a core member of our Digital Ecosystems Incubator? This is an opportunity where you can steer the technology required for a new proposition, be accountable for the technology that touches our customers, and deliver on our product roadmap. We are looking for an outstanding CTO to work directly with the Head Digital Ecosystem Incubator in a cocooned start-up environment, who will design, build, and maintain the technology stack / digital platform for this proposition ground up, select the right partners and transforming a greenfield site into a business that puts the customer-experience first and utilizes the spectrum of emerging technologies. In addition, the CTO will be part of evaluating our customer needs and, together with the team, shape our business priorities, and our response to some of the industries hardest challenges.    About role   Co-create an insurance proposition for digital ecosystems which will re-shape the industry Shape, implement, and evolve the digital insurance platform, following a customer-centric architecture Build a continuous dev-test-ops environment that is natively Cloud-based and uses automated test and build On-board ecosystems and their network partners and service them through extraordinary integration capabilities Provide and evolve digital solutions along the insurance value chain, creating an unparalleled customer experience related to servicing insurance contracts Define and deliver the roadmap for a frictionless digital analytics environment Build, lead, and develop technology squads, forming teams of solution architects and software engineers Nurture a close relationship with group technology functions, seeking commonalities among our platforms, resp. alliances within our group   About you  You bring agility and innovation, distil the “art of the possible", and embrace delivery of customer-centric solutions. As an inspirational leader, nurturing and supporting the newly created team to deliver as well as building a “one team” mentality and culture. With a background that commands instant credibility with the business and experienced in building and developing SaaS products, eCommerce or high availability platforms, you are equipped with good knowledge of how to use data to deliver business-focused solutions. When necessary, you adopt a hands-on style and "roll your sleeves up", intervening at a detailed level, whilst encouraging the teams to step-up and lead:  A forward-thinking and inspirational leader of people who can lead through times of considerable change A high EQ, low-ego individual, who is task focused, tenaciously embracing all facets of the role Able to quickly gain credibility and win trust from IT professionals and business leaders a like An outstanding communicator, intellectually strong and curious, able to explain difficult matters in a simple way Can-do attitude, understanding current and anticipating future business issues, deriving and executing the actions to address them Commercially-minded, able to create business cases for investments, and to negotiate robust contracts and partnerships with third parties. Strong analytically; skilled in analysis, systematic, rational and pragmatic Innovative and creative, can develop unique solutions to problems and explore new ways of thinking whilst remaining business and customer focused. A team-player, personally resilient, and able to withstand working under the pressure of a faced-paced environment    In your professional life, demonstrated the ability of bringing together a raft of platforms, technologies, and third-parties into coherent customer propositions. You have a track-record in delivering technological solutions within agile, fast-paced organizations and bring a wide-range of technology know-how, e.g.:  end-to-end digital services and financial services in the cloud (IaaS, PaaS and SaaS) exposing services via APIs handling large amounts of structured and unstructured data embedding leading data analytics solutions into production information security and a thorough understanding of cyber risk Emerging technologies like blockchain, AI and machine learning.    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Content:
SAP HR/HCM - Technical Lead  Location: Barcelona, Paris, Prague  Contract: Fixed-term, full-time  Duration: 12 months, renewable  Starting date: As soon as possible  Deadline for application: 17th November 2019    MSF INTERNATIONAL  Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) is an international, independent, medical humanitarian organisation that delivers emergency aid to people affected by armed conflict, epidemics, healthcare exclusion and natural disasters. MSF offers assistance to people based only on need and irrespective of race, religion, gender or political affiliation. MSF International is the legal entity that binds MSF’s 21 sections, 24 associations and other offices together (the Movement). Based in Geneva, MSF International provides coordination, information and support to the MSF Movement, as well as implements international projects and initiatives as requested. MSF International also provides administrative support to the MSF Access Campaign.    POSITION BACKGROUND  MSF has embarked on a global HRIS project of design, development and integration of HR systems and processes across 34 MSF recruitment offices. In the preliminary phase of the project, a feasibility study was carried out, functional and technical requirements defined and a HRIS solution identified. The project is now in the implementation phase, deploying SAP in the MSF offices. The Symphony Technical Lead provides hands-on technical leadership for the implementation of the tool and roll-out, coordinates the activities of the technical team and is a key member of the Management Team. This is a challenging position within a stimulating environment in a major international organization.    PLACE IN THE ORGANISATION  Inside the MSF International Office s/he will be a member of the Symphony Program Team. S/he will be based in one of the MSF hubs, will report to the Symphony Program Manager and will manage a team of 5 to 7 people. S/he is a key member of the management team of the program and as such contributes to strategies, master planning, progress updates and other management activities to ensure the successful delivery of the program.    Key responsibilities   People Management: Lead and motivate a team with diverse skills and backgrounds, recruit, support and evaluate team members under her/his responsibility. Project Management: Monitor progress of the Technical stream, manage risk and keep the program manager and management team informed about progress and expected outcomes. Has latitude in decision-making and interacts with senior management levels, which involves negotiating or influencing on significant matters. Use SAP experience to ensure the technical landscape is kept aligned with new needs coming from the program, prepare strategy to onboard new technical opportunities. Maintain and improve the technical and integration landscape. Champion Data Protection by Default on all technical undertakings to ensure compliance with GDPR and other data privacy regulations. Oversee Symphony to sections integration via deployed middleware in conjunction with the Integration Architect. Define agreements and plans with external providers assigned. Be the point of contact for technical interactions and be the validation person ensuring highest quality of technical outcomes delivered by providers. Guide/supervise the team under his/her responsibility on all technical as well as transversal undertakings. Support local teams on their roll out plans in conjunction with the roll out managers for technical topics. In conjunction with the functional team, support the finalization of the global template. Contribute to the continued handover of production support activities to the Shared IT Services Center.    The position may evolve in the coming months in terms of responsibilities and reporting lines.  
  Qualifications and work experience   Experience in managing a team, with experience of leading remote and high-performance teams MS/BS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering; Minimum of 6 years proven track record as Project manager/Technical Lead in complex environment. Experience in full life-cycle SAP projects in international environment; Experience with testing (SIT/UAT), training, knowledge transfer and deployment; Certification on Project Management (Agile, Waterfall, Accelerated SAP or SAP Activate Methodologies or others) and IT best practices (ITIL) would be a plus; Proven experience in SAP architecture design, infrastructure, networks, systems integration, security and access management; Experience in Service Delivery Management and organization; Experience with quality assurance including Data Protection and IT policies.   Specific requirements   Genuine interest in understanding of, and commitment to the humanitarian principles and challenges of MSF Demonstrated teamwork collaboration in a professional setting Quick adaptability to complex structures Ability to establish and maintain effective relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders at different levels of the organization and with implementation partners Ability to manage stress and deal with tight deadlines Strong work ethic coupled with strong analytical and problem-solving skills Willingness to travel to meet MSF needs     Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted     MSF is committed to achieving workforce diversity in terms of gender, nationality and culture. Individuals with disabilities are equally encouraged to apply.  Display original ad

Lead Salesforce Engineer  EF Education First has an immediate opening for a Lead Salesforce Engineer on the EF International Language Campuses technology team. You will be in-charge of the end to end development of our Salesforce platform, joining a new team that EF is setting up in our beautiful headquarter in Zürich. At this early stage, your role will include collaborating with our Product Owners, Solution Architects, Engineers, and Salesforce Admins, to continue the development and optimization of the platform. You will work hands-on with local and remote engineering teams to kick start projects, coach team members, and ensure that high quality solutions are delivered on time.  Later, as the team builds up, you will lead the development of new features collaborating with the business line and the other systems that integrates with yours. You will work together with multiple agile teams in Zurich and also interact with other teams around the world (limited travel). As a foundation of your skills you have a strong previous OOD background in .NET or JAVA, and experience working across the full stack in large and complex enterprise systems. You have complemented this strong foundation with the skills you have gained as a Salesforce Engineer on the Salesforce platform. You have a passion for elegant technology and design and the ability to lead & motivate developers while at the same time being an expert coder. If you are excited about tackling and solving tough problems; if you want to be part of a fast-paced work environment and work inside the support structure of a global enterprise; if you want to be a front runner in changing how our EF conducts business through technology and design - then this position is for you.  Responsibilities   Lead the engineering of our new Salesforce implementation, collaborating with other teams and technical leaders in choosing and implementing the best-in-class solutions. Champion agile best practices, software engineering methodologies, and CI/CD practices. Coordinate with the architects’ group to validate, review and promote design choices. Integrate your system with other systems engineered by teams located both in-house and remotely, coordinating engineering strategies and common activities that impact other teams Manage and advise on technical delivery of Salesforce.com projects/integrations from a technical point of view & judge the tradeoffs with technology and feasibility and make choices that fit the constraints of the projects. Direct involvement and/or oversight of developing business requirements, specifications, process flows, application design, application configuration, testing and release management. Manage Salesforce.com technical environments to ensure safe, secure and organized deployment of projects/code/configuration & administer system releases using standardized release management techniques via Salesforce DX and Git.    Mindset and Interpersonal Skills   You have excellent communication skills – not just spoken but also written. You are a team player – who is part of a successful cross-functional team having a composition of developers, QAs, BAs and Admins. Most importantly, you are sensitive to cultural differences in globally spread teams. Have strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills.    Qualifications   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related Engineering discipline. At least 8 years of software engineering and integration experience with .NET or JAVA. At least 5 years of Salesforce.com engineering experience. Great OO skills, including strong design patterns knowledge and enterprise integration paradigms. Knowledge of software best practices like Refactoring, Clean Code, Domain Driven Design, SOLID principles, etc. Demonstrative success with at least one large Salesforce.com implementation/integration project. Excellent knowledge of Salesforce.com architecture and data model. Hands-on experience in Web services and REST API development.   Who are we?  At EF Education First, we are travelers, innovators, thinkers and doers. We readily promote an open and collaborative workspace. Our people are our biggest asset, and together we have created a culture of cooperation, project ownership, and impact. As the world leader in international education, with more than 52,000 staff and teachers working in 52 countries around the globe, our mission is simple: Opening the world through education. Since we were founded over 50 years ago, EF has helped more than 15 million people see the world, learn a language, or earn an academic degree. Don't miss the unique opportunity to join our one-of-a-kind team!   E F is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. All posts are subject to an enhanced DBS and character reference checks.   Display original ad

En collaboration avec les équipes marketing et vente de Swisscom, tu participes au développement du portefeuille produits Cloud.  Pourquoi tu y parviens  Diplôme (EPF/Uni/HES) en informatique ou diplôme équivalent 5 ans d'expérience minimum dans l'installation et la maintenance d'infrastructures IT Excellentes connaissances des dernières technologies en matière de serveurs, réseau, sauvegarde (Acronis serait un plus), sécurité, virtualisation et postes de travail. Maîtrise des environnements Microsoft Windows Serveur (MCSA 2012/2016), Microsoft SQL, Microsoft Office 365/Azure, Microsoft Exchange, Microsoft Remote Desktop Services Très bonnes compétences dans la réalisation de scripts (Powershell serait un plus) Expérience dans le domaine du Cloud et de l'automatisation de provisionnement de services, un atout Certifications MCITP/MCSE/MCSA Langue maternelle française, bon niveau d'anglais, allemand un atout       Envie d’en savoir plus?En tant que Cloud System Engineer, ... tu commences le plus tôt possible ... tu travailles au sein d'une équipe sur place ... tu passes jusqu'à 20% de ton temps de travail à voyager en Suisse   Nous souhaitons repourvoir ce poste sans le soutien d'agences de placement.   ContactDario +41-58-221 13 62   Job number6391 Unité du groupeSwisscom (Schweiz) SA   Autres offres    ICT Application Engineer     ICT Architect Data Center     ICT Architect     Senior Security Engineer  Autres offres d’emploi      Ce qui t’attend   Conditions de travail équitables    Conditions de travail équitables Tu bénéficies des conditions d’engagement avancées de la convention collective de travail Swisscom (CCT). Nous payons un salaire juste et en adéquation avec le marché et récompensons également les prestations de qualité. Notre système salarial est transparent.    Prestations sociales généreuses    Prestations sociales généreuses Swisscom te propose une prévoyance vieillesse étendue via la caisse de pensions comPlan, avec des variantes individuelles pour réaliser des économies. En cas de maladie ou d’accident, nous te garantissons un droit au salaire généreux.    Monde du travail    Monde du travail Swisscom encourage activement l’innovation et l’amélioration permanente et te place au cœur du processus. Nos équipes sont interdisciplinaires. Le coworking, le prototyping et les modes de travail agiles font pleinement partie de notre culture.    Travail flexible    Travail flexible Par des horaires variables, du temps partiel ou le Job Sharing, nous aidons à concilier vie privée et vie professionnelle. Et comme les voyages permettent d’élargir les horizons, tu peux demander des congés non payés ou bien chaque année acheter jusqu’à deux semaines de vacances supplémentaires.    Famille et travail    Famille et travail Il est important pour nous que tu puisses concilier au mieux ton métier et ta vie de famille. Nous t’octroyons 18 semaines de congé de maternité et 3 semaines de congé de paternité. Avec le programme «Childcare», nous t’accompagnons sur toutes les questions concernant la prise en charge de tes enfants et, avec «Work & Care», nous t’aidons à t’occuper de proches malades.    Fringe Benefits    Fringe Benefits Nous t’offrons un rabais mensuel attrayant sur certains produits Swisscom. Tu bénéficies également de billets et abonnements aux transports publics à prix avantageux. Autre avantage: nos restaurants du personnel te proposent une nourriture saine à un prix modéré. BID MANAGER    About Atos  Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with over 110,000 employees in 73 countries and annual revenue of over € 11 billion. European number one in Cloud, Cybersecurity and High-Performance Computing, the Group provides end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications and Digital Workplace solutions. The group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and operates under the brands Atos, Atos Syntel, and Unify. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea), listed on the CAC40 Paris stock index. The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information technology space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education as well as multicultural and pluralistic approaches to research that contribute to scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the group enables its customers, employees and collaborators, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably and confidently in the information technology space.     Are you ready for your next career step? Are you a flexible, ambitious and self-starter individual with a high work ethic?   For our B&PS division based in Zurich or Nyon, we are currently looking for a    Bid Manager (m/f)     Responsibilities   Leading bids with full responsibility of:  following Atos processes estimation, requesting, controlling bid budget bid team crafting and daily work orchestration   Responsible for the creation of high quality and Atos compliant offers Responsible for Risk Management (identification & mitigation actions) for managed bids Responsible for the handover of a won bid into delivery Responsible for lessons learnt of a lost bid Contributes in defining the financial business case with Sales and Financial Architect Contributes to challenge the solution with Sales, Solution Team and Atos Management Responsible for the coordination of proposal project plan and implementation, budget, processes, risk management & strategy and all quality aspects related to the proposal process Working closely with Sales     Profile and skills   University degree (HF/FH) in economics, finance, management or a comparable education and training Minimum 3 years of Project Management experience Good team coach, i.e. has good leadership qualities to form, motivate and lead an interdepartmental (often remotely) team Minimum basic financial calculation skills (effort, cost, risk, margin) Write up skills, quality in language and content of written proposals Graphic flair, i.e. ensuring that the final form of the offer document is visually appealing and in line with corporate branding guideliness Creativity- out of the box thinking and result-oriented Able to lead client conversation around demand, proposal details Communicative (open minded, people-friendly, understanding cultures) Self-organized, responsible person Willing to travel across Switzerland and Europe on a short-term basis Excellent MS Office skills (Word, PPT, Excel) and any Project Management tools Language skills: German or French mother tongue, fluent in English   Your Application If you wish to apply for this position, please click below to complete our online application form and attach your CV in either Word, rtf or text format.Atos does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, age, disability or sexual orientation. All recruitment decisions are based solely on qualifications, skills, knowledge and experience and relevant business requirements.We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the applications process for people with disabilities.
