Ultimately your mission is to grow OCI consumption and ensure customers are paying, using and happy with the OCI platform. What we offer Unlimited opportunity. We're growing extremely fast which is both exciting and challenging at the same time. We give you the freedom, respect, and resources to do what you need to do, so your job doesn’t have to feel like a job. If you like a little bit of a faster pace, you’ll love it here. If you thrive at a faster pace our growth stands to advance your career by leaps and bounds. Grow the team, grow your skills, and enjoy working with an organization who is changing the enterprise IT landscape! Ability to Work Remotely. While it would be great if you happen to live near one of our core offices, it’s not an absolute requirement. We collaborate using Slack and Zoom and it works great. Our hours and 'location' are super flexible. Many of our outbound PMs work effectively in various parts of the world. Grow your Cloud Skills. We have a steady stream of incredibly exciting and challenging migration and deployment work, most of it referred directly from our customers. Work alongside extremely talented solutions architects and learn the OCI platform inside and out. We work with retail companies, financial services companies, Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) companies, and more, solving some of the juiciest technical problems you’ll ever encounter. You will never get bored here! Overall Responsibilities   Be the technical point of contact and subject-matter-expert for all OCI service offerings, aligning with specific regional field teams   Be the voice of the customer – develop a comprehensive understanding of their business/technical objectives   Document customer interactions and executive updates via internal CRM tool; report status to management on a weekly basis   Monitor weekly usage reports and identify consumption trends for your overall territory   Contribute to external publications such as the OCI Blog, Whitepapers and Reference architectures   Help to recruit, train and onboard new Outbound PMs   Presales Activities (33% of your time)   Align with Sales Leadership to help educate and position OCI (Why OCI, Sales Plays, etc)   Align with individual Sales Teams (ECAs, Iaas Co Primes, CPRs and KADs) to identify opportunities you will help progress to closure   Align with the OCI Business Operations team to forecast future capacity demand   Own the customer Proof-of-Concepts from beginning to end including tenancy provisioning, customer onboarding, issue mitigation/escalation and final conversion to paid tenancy   Deliver OCI demos showcasing basic OCI functions such as provisioning users/groups, creating roles, VCNs, spinning up Compute instances and launching DB instances   Work with the competitive team to understand OCI technical and business differentiators; advocate these differentiators to customers, partners and field teams   Postsales Activities (33% of your customers)   Identify the top 10% accounts in your territory (by consumption) and create a usage plan around those accounts   Deliver OCI Technical Reference Architectures specific to the customers business need and use cases (e.g. EBS/PSFT/JDE lift-n-shift, On prem>OCI, OCIC>OCI, etc)   Ensure customer applications run successfully by working closely with the extended Oracle technical teams; SAs, CSMs, A-Team and Oracle Support and Field Teams (ECA, Iaas reps, CPR and KADs)   Align with Inbound PM and SA teams to understand new OCI features and roadmap items and proactively communicate these to the customer on a regular basis   Leverage existing whitepapers, blogs and technical documents to design solutions that address customer technical and business requirements   Partner with the OCI training team to expand OCI demos that utilize multiple OCI services (e.g. 3 Tier Photo App, Chatbot App, Blockchain on OCI, etc)   Identify and provide early access to OCI limited availability (LA) services as appropriate by working closely with OCI Inbound PMs, Solution Architects and Engineering teams   Advocate for new product feature requests – collaborate with Inbound Product Teams to prioritize these into the OCI product release cycle (e.g. Customer Enablement "Pain Points" process)   Develop a “risk mitigation” plan to optimize the customers UCM and on prem license usage to ensure maximum ROI and OCI consumption   Identify, nominate and recruit customers to key OCI programs/events such as OOW, TAB, etc. For customers who cannot attend, deliver executive summaries   Provide customers peer comparisons and reference architectures for their industries and use cases   Identify customer WIN themes to explain “Why OCI” and use these to create another narrative for the next OCI opportunity within the account (e.g. land-and-expand)   Field Enablement (33% of your customers)  Support regional field-enablement activities to include:  o Product training o Field Account Planning o Regional Event Support o OCI Region Launch Activities Requirements   10 years of IT infrastructure experience   Experience working directly with the "C-Suite"   Broad experience with Iaas including Compute, Networking, Storage, Database, Security, DR/HA, etc.   Knowledge of Oracle Databases and hands on experience with SQL   Hands on experience with Linux installation, configuration, troubleshooting   Experience managing client relationships, offering strategic IT advice, and keeping customers happy   Dynamic presenter with the ability to break down technical concepts into everyday language   Ability to operate in a highly ambiguous and fast paced environment   Preferred   MBA or advanced technical degree   AWS/Azure/GCP experience and/or certification is a bonus    Detailed Description and Job Requirements  Work as part of a team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing of product(s) as they move from conception to distribution. Organize interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget. As a member of the product development division, you will define product specifications and or strategy. Gather and analyze information to define product specifications and review design specifications. Communicate product strategy and functionality. Initiate and foster relationships with other groups. Review product documentation and collateral. Ensure successful product releases based on corporate priorities. Duties and tasks are varied and complex, needing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 4 years of software engineering or related experience.  As part of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required to successfully complete a pre-employment screening process. This will involve identity and employment verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).   Job: Product Development  Location: CH-Switzerland  Other Locations: ES-ES,Spain-LAS ROZAS DE MADRID, FR-FR,France-LYON, IT-IT,Italy-Cinisello Balsamo, CH-CH,Switzerland-Zurich, IT-Italy, FR-FR,France-COLOMBES CEDEX, FR-France, ES-ES,Spain-Barcelona, ES-Spain, PT-Portugal, Portugal, CH-CH,Switzerland-Baden-Daettwil, ES-ES,Spain-Madrid, IT-IT,Italy-Rome  Job Type: Regular Employee Hire  Organization: Oracle Display original ad

Job title: Manager - Financial Services Consulting Transformation & Digital Services
Content: Manager - Financial Services Consulting Transformation & Digital Services EPAM is among the fastest growing technology firms globally with over 33’100 EPAMers (88+ locations & 25 countries) with inspiring careers from day one. Our people are the source of our success and we value collaboration, try to always understand our customers’ business, and strive for the highest standards of excellence. We enable our clients’ business transformation by engaging multi-disciplinary teams combining deep business expertise with design thinking, emerging technology solutions, engineering, and leading tools and frameworks for optimizing performance. We are passionate consultants, orchestrators, designers, architects and engineers who enable our customers to be competitive and disruptive in the marketplace through innovative technology solutions, business-led transformation while navigating successfully through change. JOB ROLE Here at EPAM, we are expanding our global Financial Services Consulting practice. The growth we are experiencing is driving the need for transformation consultants (various levels) across the Financial Services industry who are aspiring to join a vibrant, growing business and dynamic team culture. We cover Wealth & Asset Management, Insurance, Retail Banking, Capital Markets, Payments, and emerging Neobanks / digital FS firms. At EPAM, you can make a difference. We are entrepreneurial. We enable our people to take ownership and responsibility in setting the direction for all of our practices. This Manager position is part of EPAM’s Financial Services Consulting - Wealth Management & Insurance Practice hub in Zurich covering various working locations as client and business development requires. Due to strategic growth in the immediate term, we are targeting experienced consultants possessing “hands-on” know-how in Finance Function Transformation i.e. improvements to finance, accounting, controlling and management reporting processes via business technology change in Banking / Wealth Management firms. Additionally, we offer you the opportunity to leverage your broader FS domain subject matter expertise, particular segment specializations, in-depth consulting foundation skills and “hands-on” transformational experience to delivery of advisory services in support of technology-enabled business change. The role is primarily focused with project execution responsibilities and faces off to key client contacts, SME’s plus support managing client relationships. Bring in your knowledge and experience with performing transformation services throughout the project lifecycle from strategic execution to solution development enabling engineering services pull-through for the firm. Participate in supporting consulting capability with pre-sale opportunities, active pursuits, and proposals and the development of thought leadership, and value propositions. Actively contribute to developing key FS transformation themes and learning to stay at the forefront of disruption trends shaping the industry / relevant segment(s). Enhance your further potential in leveraging innovative methodologies, frameworks, tools, accelerators and enablers for a range of transformation objectives. You will be a supporting ambassador for change, help solve business and operational challenges while supporting client ambitions. You have a keen interest in developing innovative approaches and solutions from concept to delivery. Our consultants are active across all aspects of project delivery e.g. strategic envisioning, UI/UX/CX service design, digital transformation, business / operating model change, business architecture modelling, business-driven technology and software engineering solutions, data analytics and intelligent automation solutions. Realize your opportunity to take on increased levels of responsibility and continuously challenge yourself in both client and internal initiatives. #LI-DNI  Requirements Minimum 5+ years’ relevant combined industry and consulting experience (internal / external) with at least 2 years at a Senior Consultant / Manager level. Consulting experience with “Big-4” Advisory and/or reputable consultancy boutiques / system integrators / internal consulting transformation roles within banking (i.e. majority in wealth mgmt.) business domain focus is required Possess FS business domain knowledge with a focus in Banking, and Wealth & Asset Mgmt. Functional know-how and broad experience with Finance Functions, controlling and reporting processes / business technology change, transformation and improvements as well as organizational setups Brings “hands-on” project experience in consulting with business-led technology transformational projects (i.e. digitalization, automation, platforms, core-banking, FinTechs) Ability to advise across various functional areas and possess a broad understanding in financial services areas such as: business topics, business / IT architecture, operating models, digitalization / CX, client journeys, wealth advisory setups, client onboarding, risk & compliance frameworks, front-to-back processes, finance & reporting functions, key FS regulatory awareness etc Strong consultant business analysis foundation skills: i.e. business requirements engineering, process design and workflow documentation, user journeys / use cases, workshop facilitation, managing project delivery schedules, progress reporting, project risk mitigation measures and stakeholder management Strong ability and curiosity to analyze problems in a systematic and organized fashion and is at ease with multi-disciplinary teams working across dispersed geographies and cultures Ability to determine and prepare functional business requirements from workshops with main Customer’s stakeholders to working across full lifecycle in operational solution development processes from requirements gathering to implementation. Experience with identification and evaluation of potential solution options against business and technical suitability Sound knowledge of stream-level project management methods / PMO roles within multi-disciplinary project environments Strong team player who can work with minimal day-to-day guidance for assignments with a flexible working style within multi-national teams with project delivery teams Very good communication, presentation and cooperation with external /internal stakeholders, client facing soft skill sets and facilitation abilities (i.e. interview and workshop techniques) Fluency in verbal and written English language skills. Fluency in spoken German is an asset. Our global corporate working language is English Bachelors / Master's degree from an accredited university. Additional relevant professional qualifications are additional assets Position is based in Zurich but candidate should have a willingness to travel as required for business development meetings and client project onsite interval stints for delivery We offer Competitive compensation depending on skills and experience Knowledge-sharing across EPAM's global Tech Communities Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions Relocation support as per EPAM relocation policies EPAM Community with regular corporate and social events Career growth, performance and compensation reviews   Display original ad

Principal Consultant - Enterprise Architecture (w/m) 80-100%Your job.  You are inspired by digital transformation projects. As a consultant you will support our customers in the development of groundbreaking architectural overviews. You will identify innovative ways in which new, disruptive technologies can be integrated into traditional architectures or how companies can develop platforms and ecosystems that economically support new digital business models. An important part of your work will be your powerful communication at C-level. You will play a key role in our service development and offer support in recruiting and developing talent. You will give advice in sophisticated, strategically important architecture projects. Your strength is in developing enterprise architectures together with interdisciplinary teams. You will enjoy positioning Zühlke and our portfolio effectively on the market (pre-sales) and you will bring quotations to a successful conclusion. Your architecture proposals are future-oriented and facilitate the implementation of business strategy or new business models. You are very familiar with the most important issues in architecture management and can incorporate this knowledge into your consultancy mandates. You can assess IT landscapes methodically and identify quickly which systems and processes are functioning efficiently. You can identify critical weaknesses and propose effective countermeasures. Concise, targeted communication with management and agile developer teams will be a regular component of your work. Your personal qualities help build trust, team spirit, energy and clarity. You will facilitate architecture workshops and collectively develop ideas for architectures, architecture management and road maps. Your concepts accurately explain meaning and purpose, opportunities and risks, and result in well-founded recommendations. You are self-critical, dynamic and don’t lock yourself in an ivory tower. Your talent.  Successfully completed university degree, ideally in information technology, business informatics or similar Extensive professional experience as an enterprise architect; experience in more than one industry is desirable but not a requirement. Thorough knowledge of architecture frameworks (e.g. TOGAF or other lightweight frameworks) Competence in the areas of lean, agile and DevOps Both a technical background in software engineering and experience with business analysis and project management are required. Practical experience with current architecture concepts such as microservices, SOA and omnichannel Wide-ranging knowledge of current technologies (e.g. cloud, mobile, IoT, big data/ machine learning/AI, blockchain or AR/VR) and their influence on enterprise architecture Outstanding communication skills in German and English Ability to learn quickly and strong problem-solving skills Analytical, customer-oriented, creative and innovative Team-oriented with strong personal integrity, valuable coach, building trust with customers in the long term Display original ad

Job title: Specialist Azure for Public Sector Customers
Content: Specialist Azure for Public Sector Customers  Microsoft is a company where passionate innovators come to collaborate, envision what can be, and take their careers to levels they can't achieve anywhere else. This is a world of more possibilities, more innovation, more openness, and sky's-the-limit thinking -- a cloud-enabled world. At Microsoft we have unique capabilities to meet the needs of both individuals and organizations. We care deeply about taking our ideals and vision around the globe, and to make a difference in peoples' lives and organizations in all corners of the planet. Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet. Are you insatiably curious? Do you embrace uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from your mistakes? Do you collaborate well with others, knowing that better solutions come from working together? Do you stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve, and are you motivated every day to empower others to achieve more through technology and innovation? Are you ready to join the team that is at the leading edge of Innovation at Microsoft? To learn more about Microsoft’s mission, please visit: https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-culture Check out all our products at: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us   Responsibilities   As an Azure Specialist for the Public Sector in Switzerland, you will be a solution seller within our enterprise sales organization working with our most important customers. You will lead a virtual team of technical, partner and consulting resources to advance the sales process to achieve/exceed quarterly Windows Server and System Center solution sales and Azure Infrastructure usage/consumption targets for related workloads in your assigned accounts. You will be an Azure and Datacenter Infrastructure subject matter expert. You will build and maintain relationships with customers, influence long-term strategic direction and act as a trusted advisor driving engagement at the CXO level with technology decision makers. You will help customers evaluate their cloud strategy, determine approaches to application and data migration and modernization, and recommend solutions that meet their requirements. You will remove roadblocks to deployment and drive customer satisfaction.   Primary Accountabilities For This Role Include     40% of your time will be spent with customers identifying and surfacing new engagements that align with the customer’s business strategy. You will work with partners and others at Microsoft, as well as use our core tools and targeted account lists to identify and engage prioritized customers. You will be required to be disciplined in business-management, adaptable to a culture of accountability and build a strong and active business network.   40% of your time will be spent on being the key technical leader, trusted advisor and influencer in shaping customer decisions to buy and adopt Microsoft Azure and Datacenter Infrastructure solutions. You will win the customers’ technical decision for sales opportunities and usage scenarios through tailored messaging, engaging with them to show our technology differentiation, and guiding them in decision making. You will lead presentations and solution demonstrations to explain and prove to our largest customers the capabilities of Microsoft Hybrid Datacenter and Infrastructure solutions, and how we can make their businesses more successful.   20% of your time will be spent on influencing the Microsoft Azure Infrastructure and Hybrid Datacenter go-to-market strategies by providing feedback to sales, marketing, and engineering on current and future product requirements and sales blockers. You will be recognized for sharing, learning and driving work that results in business impact for customers, partners and Microsoft. We encourage thought leadership and we encourage all our employees to continuously maintain and enhance their technical, sales, professional skills and competitive readiness. You will therefore be required to attain and maintain required certifications.    Qualifications    Professional     Experience. +2 years’ experience selling business solutions to large/global enterprise customers with a focus on application and infrastructure technologies preferred   Account Management. Effective territory/account management: planning, opportunity qualification and creation, stakeholder and executive communication, needs analysis, value engineering, services/partner engagement, opportunity management, pipeline management, large dollar licensing and deal negotiation required   Executive Presence. Experience and expertise selling to senior business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the value of the solution to the customer’s overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria.  Problem Solver. Ability to solve customer problems through cloud technologies required   Collaborative. Orchestrate and influence virtual teams to pursue sales opportunities and lead v-teams through influence   Technical     Azure Platform. Understanding of Microsoft server products and/or complementing solutions. The position requires the ability to articulate and present the business value of Microsoft's solutions and have a firm understanding of Microsoft's strategies and products relative to major Microsoft competitors preferred   Leadership. Experience leading large cloud engagements, especially those involving Infrastructure modernization and migration preferred   Competitive Landscape. Knowledge of enterprise software solutions and cloud and datacenter infrastructure competitor landscape  Partners. Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs  Certifications. Azure Admin Associate or Architect required     Industry     Public Sector know-how. Deep understanding of the public sector in Switzerland as well as a strong network into decision making stakeholders. +2 years of experience either working in the Public Sector or selling solutions to this vertical. required    Education  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a similar information technology-related discipline, MBA preferred, or equivalent experience   Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.    Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.  Display original ad

Solution Engineer    Solution Engineer  Zurich Customer Success – Services Full-time    Apply for this job      The Customer Success department is responsible for the post-sales experience of the Appway customers. Through the Customer Success Services, we ensure successful adoption and value realization through the best possible use of the Appway solutions, platform, and business components. We offer implementation services, trainings and expert services. We strive to making the customer journey a success by creating value and maximizing the adoption of the Appway products.    Appway Solution Engineers are essential members of our Customer Success team, engaging with our customers and partners to tailor the Appway platform to their specific needs and integrate Appway into their IT landscape.   As a Solution Engineer, you are responsible for defining and designing the architecture for new client initiatives. You lead workshops with clients and work closely with colleagues from Customer Success and beyond to ensure client satisfaction with proposed solutions. You take user experience, system performance, the Appway product itself, and many other aspects into consideration when identifying the best technical solution to the set of complex requirements you are presented with. You have a solid engineering background, as well as the capacity to adapt swiftly to different business contexts. You are able to rapidly pick up clients’ vocabulary, and quickly understand their goals.   In this role you will become an expert at Appway, helping clients and fellow Appway developers solve intricate and challenging technical matters. You will have the opportunity to influence the digital transformation of our clients, be responsible for the quality of the solutions and the platform, translate the complex business requirements into efficient solutions, and support the delivery of high-quality Appway solutions.   As part of your job, you provide coaching and run troubleshooting sessions with clients and colleagues when a more in-depth understanding of the product is required. These sessions will often result in your needing to build prototypes or client-specific custom modules. Therefore, the ability to execute ad hoc hands-on assignments is a must.   You will create collaterals and best practice guidelines based on your day-to-day experience with Appway. You will feed the Appway Product department feature requests and bug reports with your creative ideas, and you will help us improve the product and steer the roadmap even closer to market needs    Are you the perfect fit for Appway?   You are a fast learner, passionate about technology and software, and always looking forward to learn about new paradigms and techniques You have a positive, “can-do” attitude and are dedicated to continuous improvements You enjoy finding ways to feed intelligence back to your colleagues as well as into the products and tasks you work on You are a great problem solver, able to analyze multiple options and pick the most suitable path, reverse engineering is intriguing you You like to work as a part of a team, and are able to handle multiple assignments efficiently You are intrigued by bridging the gaps between Business, Solutions, Products and Technology by providing efficient and innovative solutions You like working on short-term assignments at short notice, rather than being involved in the same initiative for a longer timeframe You are ready and willing to support colleagues and clients in removing any roadblocks they are experiencing As a perfectionist, you take great pride in the quality of your work, ensuring that the outcome of your work performs and meets the technical and functional requirements. This also means you aim to deliver on time, and you can prioritize and manage your tasks accordingly You possess strong verbal and written communication skills and do not shy away from customer interaction. You can present complex solutions within a customer-facing environment, using a communication style appropriate to the audience.       Main Responsibilities:   Analyze customers' organizational structures and business processes; investigate their architectural needs and explore existing legacy solutions Provide coaching and run troubleshooting sessions with clients and colleagues when a more in-depth understanding of the product is required as a subject matter expert Manage customer challenges and adapt solutions to meet various business requirements in liaison with the consulting team Design adapters and connectors that integrate Appway with existing systems, drive implementation and leverage in-house product capabilities Take responsibility for the quality of the customers’ solutions, system performances, stability and upgradeability Support customers and fellow Appway colleagues when intricate and challenging technical matters arise Work on complex customer cases and bring new ideas for innovation and automation excellence via prototypes and client-specific modules. Work closely with the Product and Engineering Teams to find ways to improve the product Actively engage with the account executives to develop new opportunities Provide feedback to the Appway Customer Success team on business adoption and value realization of the implemented business processes       Required Skills:   Master’s degree or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent 3+ years of experience in a hands-on, deeply technical, software development role 1+ year of experience as a software architect, with responsibility for designing the architecture for at least one enterprise-scale project Excellent academic record or professional certifications that demonstrate your ability to learn quickly and think out of the box Experience in at least one large enterprise software architecture project, where scalability, security, and data integrity topics were relevant concerns Experience in developing at least one three-tier Web Application, and a good understanding of the technologies belonging to all three tiers Demonstrable proficiency in object-oriented core programming languages (Java is preferred) Demonstrable experience with various integration protocols, including different kinds of Web Service frameworks Demonstrable experience with web services, queues and databases such as, but not limited to: REST, SOAP, Oracle, MS/SQL, PostgreSQL Demonstrable experience of web technologies such as Javascript, HTML 5, React, Angular, CSS, Ajax, XML Hands-on experience with application server technologies such as Tomcat, IBM WebSphere, Weblogic Business fluency in English A willingness to travel to customer locations throughout Switzerland and internationally (approx. 25%)       Desired Skills:   Fluency in German Experience with container-based technologies such as Docker, OpenShift, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry Hands-on experience with IDEs such as IntelliJ or Eclipse Exposure to CI/CD architectures Experience with agile methodologies Understanding of SaaS, PaaS models      Apply for this job   Display original ad

Performance Testing Engineer 80% bis 100%    What you achieveGood performance of an application is key to a good user experience. We are a passionate team working according to the agile mindset. As a member of our team, you contribute to improving the performance of several applications within the Swisscom IT landscape. Our mission is to support large solutions with performance engineering and enabling them to create their own benchmarking as well as verifying the customer experience. Your job is to define and execute testing approaches. Additionally, you leverage your developing skills by collaborating with database administrators, solution architects, and operations. Our team is constantly evolving. We are always open to new ideas and new technologies to improve the user experience.  Why you succeed  Degree (ETH/Uni/UAS) in computer science or related fields Experience with performance engineering Know-how of performance tools like LoadRunner, NeoLoad, JMeter, Gatling, or Karate. Knowledge of automation tools like Selenium Experience with monitoring and CI/CD tools (Jenkins) Familiar with cloud technologies Fluency in written and spoken English, German a plus       Curious to know more?As Performance Testing Engineer ... you start as soon as possible ... can partly work from the home office ... no regular travel activity is planned   We intend to fill this position without involvement of external recruiting or placement companies. DevOps Engineer Container Platform 80% bis 100%    What you achieveWe are a team of highly motivated DevOps professionals. As such, we deliver end-to-end and operate all the services we produce. By joining us, you both develop new services and keep them running in the long term. Your focus is on engineering a new product for our Container-as-a-Service solution based on Kubernetes, implemented with VMWare PKS on NSX-T. You create an architectural concept in collaboration with our network and software architects. Then you take it from development to deployment, and finally to operation. Our first-class, multidisciplinary, and international environment lets you apply your existing expertise and continuously learn about new technologies and trends.  Why you succeed  Degree (Uni/UAS) in computer science or related field In-depth knowledge of and experience with at least one programming language (e.g. Go, Python, Java), willing to work with other languages Experience with automation, monitoring, and CI/CD tools Familiarity with distributed systems, in particular with Kubernetes Knowledge of VMware PKS, VMware NSX-T, or BOSH is a plus DevOps mindset, willingness to work on operational tasks in various fields Team player, happy to work in an agile team Fluency in written and spoken English       Curious to know more?As a DevOps Engineer Container Platform ... you start as soon as possible ... you can partly work from the home office ... you travel up to 20% of your working time   We intend to fill this position without involvement of external recruiting or placement companies. Flexible working    Flexible working Our flexible, part-time or job sharing working models let you achieve a healthy work-life balance. And because travel broadens our horizons, you can either apply for unpaid leave or purchase up to two weeks of additional holiday per year.    Work and family    Work and family Helping you optimally combine your work and family life is very important to us. Swisscom provides for 18 weeks of maternity leave and 3 weeks of paternity leave. Our childcare programme assists you with matters related to taking care of your children, while the Work & Care programme lets you take care of sick family members.    Fringe benefits    Fringe benefits We offer you a generous monthly discount on certain Swisscom products. You also benefit from discounted tickets and travel cards on public transport. The healthy, low-cost meals that you can enjoy at our staff restaurants are an additional benefit.        Fair working conditions You benefit from the progressive employment conditions of the Swisscom Collective Employment Agreement (CEA). Salaries at Swisscom are fair and market-driven with bonuses for good performance. Our salary system is transparent.     Generous employee benefits Through its pension fund comPlan, Swisscom offers you extensive pension plans with individual savings options. We guarantee generous continued salary payments in the event of illness or accident. DWH EXPERT  We are looking for an individual with a B. Tech / B.E. or M. Tech or MCA degree, with 2-5 years of experience in IT-DWH applications development or related consulting. 2-5 years of overall experience in IT-DWH applications development or related consulting. 2-5 years of designing and developing experience with Informatica is must. 2-5 years of experience in SAP Business Objects and Crystal Reports reporting tool is must. Strong SQL knowledge Experience working with Oracle Database Experience in PL/SQL programming is must. Technical knowledge of Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) solutions for Business Intelligence projects. Strong analytical skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to do ETL development and to supervise and guide ETL development activities of other developers. Practical understanding and implementation of best practices, performance tuning and optimization for all the developed codes. The individual will have to serve as the Lead Designer of all ETL activities for projects. Work closely with project Business Analyst, Data Modeler and BI Lead to ensure that the end to end designs meet the business and data requirements. Active involvement in the ETL Processes. Generate ETL Test Data. Involvement in Unit and Integration. Testing activities and assist in User Acceptance Testing as needed. Be eager to work on other Reporting technologies. Senior Entwickler - Architekt (m/w) 80-100%   Senior Entwickler - Architekt (m/w) 80-100%    SOFTCOM AG ist ein Schweizer Unternehmen, das Hightech-Software entwickelt. Seit 2001 haben wir erfolgreich zahlreiche komplexe und anspruchsvolle Projekte für Kunden aus dem privaten und öffentlichen Bereich durchgeführt. Wir sind spezialisiert auf die Implementierung von Unternehmensportalen, auf Mobilapplikationen und auf die Zusammenführung von heterogenen Systemen. Zudem sind wir als Entwicklungspartner, als IT-Systemintegratoren oder – je nach Bedürfnissen unserer Kunden oder Art des Auftrags – als Dienstleister tätig. Zur Verstärkung unseres Spezialisten Teams in Bern sind wir auf der Suche nach einem/-er Senior Entwickler/-in – Architekt/-in.    AUFTRAG  Erarbeitung und Beschreibung der technischen Lösungsarchitektur für grosse Digitalisierungsprojekte mittels agilen Methoden, unter Berücksichtigung der aktuellsten Technologietrends.    HAUPTAUFGABEN:   Erstellung von Gesamtarchitekturen und Systemarchitekturen auf Grundlage funktionaler und nichtfunktionaler Anforderungen Erstellung von Schnittstellenbeschreibungen Erstellen eines Integrationskonzeptes zwischen verschiedenen Applikationen Erstellung von Datenmodellen auf Geschäfts- oder logischer Ebene     PROFIL:   Informatikabschluss (Master/Bachelor, ETH/Uni, FH oder vergleichbar) Zertifizierung als Certified Professional for Software Architecture (z.B. nach ISAQB oder TOGAF) Mehrjährige Erfahrung als Lösungsarchitekt, Softwarearchitekt, Datenarchitekt oder Unternehmensarchitekt Erfahrung bei der Architekturdokumentation mit UML oder ähnlichenDokumentationstemplates Erfahrungen im Einsatz von Microservices, Applikationsplattformen as a Service, Erfahrung im agilen Umfeld (Scrum, Hermes) Sehr gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten und hohe Eigenverantwortung Starke Kundenorientierung und Verhandlungsgeschick     WIR BIETEN:   Brillante Kollegen und flache Hierarchien Arbeit in einem agilen dynamischen und sympathischen Umfeld Möglichkeiten für die berufliche Weiterentwicklung im Unternehmen Spannende Projekte in unterschiedlichen Tätigkeitsbereichen (Transportwesen, Energie, Telekommunikation, Government) Auf Innovation ausgerichtete Struktur und die Möglichkeit die Technologien mitzugestalten     INTERESSIERT ?
